ignicolor: <entryFree id="n21391" type="hapax" key="igni^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭcŏlor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-color</etym>, <sense id="n21391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fire-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flame-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> in Matt. 4, 26, 557</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignicomans: <entryFree id="n21392" type="hapax" key="igni^co^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭcŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>igniscoma</etym>, <sense id="n21392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having fiery hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery-haired;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignicomus: <entryFree id="n21393" type="main" key="igni^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fieryhaired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 214</bibl></cit>; cf. preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
igniculus: <entryFree id="n21394" type="main" key="igni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ignis</etym>, <sense id="n21394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spark.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21394.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cb n="IGNI" /> quaedam exigua animalia igniculi videntur in tenebris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21394.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of color, <hi rend="ital">a glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onyx Indica igniculos habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 24, § 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 7, 25, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21394.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, etc. (freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo tolerabilius feramus igniculum desiderii tui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vehemence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: (natura) parvulos nobis dedit igniculos, quos celeriter malis moribus opinionibusque depravatis sic restinguimus, ut nusquam naturae lumen appareat, <hi rend="ital">sparks</hi> (= scintillas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi virtutum igniculi et semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullos interdum jacit igniculos viriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii igniculos ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 7.</sense></entryFree>
ignifer: <entryFree id="n21395" type="main" key="igni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-fero</etym>, <sense id="n21395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fire-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n21395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 459</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:490" default="NO" valid="yes">490</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: sidus, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1027" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 1027</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:342" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 342</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n21395.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignifero mentes furiabat in iram Hortatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:294" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 294</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignifluus: <entryFree id="n21396" type="hapax" key="igni^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n21396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing with fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emitting fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignigena: <entryFree id="n21397" type="hapax" key="Igni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ignĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ignis-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n21397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fire-born</hi>, a poetical epithet of Bacchus, whose mother, Semele, was killed by lightning, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 305 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ignigenus: <entryFree id="n21398" type="hapax" key="igni^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose pack was on fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
igninus: <entryFree id="n21399" type="main" key="igni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis</etym>, <sense id="n21399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing in the fire;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fireman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 2</bibl> Hild.</sense></entryFree>
ignio: <entryFree id="n21400" type="main" key="igni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ignite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make red-hot</hi> (post-class.): ut igniverint, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1077.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21400.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether, App. de Mundo, p. 57: tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 61.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vinum natura esset ignitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: draconis effigies ignitissima, Jul. Var. Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 56.— </sense><sense id="n21400.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 546</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ignipes: <entryFree id="n21401" type="main" key="igni^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-pes</etym>, <sense id="n21401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fieryfooted</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 392</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignipotens: <entryFree id="n21402" type="main" key="Igni^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ignĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-potens</etym>, <sense id="n21402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">potent in fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler of fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignipotent</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Vulcan (Vergilian): <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 90</bibl></cit>.—Also as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ignĭpŏ-tens</orth> = Vulcan, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 414</bibl>; 423; 628; 710; 10, 243.</sense></entryFree>
ignis: <entryFree id="n21403" type="main" key="ignis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> usu. igni; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug. igne; so Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 98</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 33</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 766</bibl> P.; and always in Mart., e. g. 1, 21, 5; 4, 57, 6; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 223 sq.; <sense id="n21403.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">scanned ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 566</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:853" default="NO" valid="yes">853</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but ignīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. agnis, fire; Lith. ugn-is; Slav. ogný; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ai)/glh, a)glao/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi> (com mon in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf. flamma, incendium). </sense><sense id="n21403.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum conflictu atque tritu elici ignem videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admoto igni ignem concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati ab igne ignem capere, si qui velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">datur ignis, tametsi ab inimico petas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number> = <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">subditis ignibus aquae fervescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes naturae numini divino, caelum, ignes, terrae, maria parerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce animus datus est ex illis sempiternis ignibus, quae sidera et stellas vocatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fumo atque ignibus significabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pluribus simul locis ignes coörti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus armata multitudo, facibusque ardentibus collucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes fieri prohibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem accendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem circum subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem operibus inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem comprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igni cremari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbi ferro ignique minitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis in aquam conjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi incuria insulariorum ignis evaserit (opp. incendium inferre),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulsere ignes et conscius aether,</quote> <trans><tr>lightnings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 167</bibl></cit>; cf.: Diespiter Igni corusco nubila <pb n="881" /> <cb n="IGNO" /> dividens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum abscondere tenebrae nube una subitusque antennas impulit ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:226" default="NO">13, 226</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">micat inter omnes Julium sidus, velut inter ignes luna minores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib. 1:12:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam per moenia clarior ignis Auditur,</quote> <trans><tr>the crackling of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumenidum ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>torches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:285" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 285</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21403.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21403.3" n="a" level="4"> Sacer ignis, a disease, <hi rend="ital">St. Anthony's fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erysipelas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 566</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21403.4" n="b" level="4"> Aqua et ignis, to signify the most important necessaries of life; v. aqua.—</sense><sense id="n21403.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redness</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fronte curvatos imitatus ignes lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam clarus occultum Andromedae pater Ostendit ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 17</bibl></cit>; so of the <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi> of the stars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 452</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 665</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the sun,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:778" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 778</bibl></cit>; 4, 194; 7, 193; <cit><quote lang="la">of Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:629" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcano florentes igne smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:276" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 276</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:109" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 109</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">acies stupet igne metalli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ignis oculorum cum eo igne qui est ob os offusus,</quote> <trans><tr>redness</tr>, <tr>blush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:516" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 516</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21403.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Firewood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fuel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis miseris atque ignis emendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21403.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21403.8" n="A" level="2"> (Mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <hi rend="ital">The fire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glow of passion</hi>, in a good or bad sense; of anger, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exarsere ignes animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevos irarum concipit ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:748" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 748</bibl></cit>; most freq. of <hi rend="ital">the flame of love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum odium non restingueritis, huic ordini ignem novum subici non sivistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurigerosque ignes, si quando avidissimus hauri,</quote> <trans><tr>raving</tr>, <tr>inspiration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:509" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae simul aethereos animo conceperat ignes, ore dabat pleno carmina vera dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:473" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Dido) caeco carpitur igni,</quote> <trans><tr>the secret fire of love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 490</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">195</bibl>; 675 et saep.; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 410</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 492</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">socii ignes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>nuptials</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 796</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21403.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like amores, <hi rend="ital">a beloved object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flame</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi sese offert ultro meus ignis, Amyntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21403.10" n="B" level="2"> Figuratively of that which brings destruction, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ille obrutum ignem (i. e. bellum) reliquerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne parvus hic ignis (i. e. Hannibal) incendium ingens exsuscitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et Syphacem et Carthaginienses, nisi orientem illum ignem oppressissent, ingenti mox incendio arsuros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Masinissa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 31, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignispicium: <entryFree id="n21404" type="hapax" key="ignispi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignispĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ignis-specio</etym>, <sense id="n21404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a divining from fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divination by fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ignitabulum: <entryFree id="n21405" type="main" key="igni_ta_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignītābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ignio</etym>, <sense id="n21405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement for producing fire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, § 19</bibl>; cf.: ignitabulum ignis receptaculum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 105</bibl> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n21405.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii virtutisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignitulus: <entryFree id="n21406" type="main" key="igni_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignītŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n21406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [ignitus, from ignio], <hi rend="ital">somewhat fiery</hi> (post-class.): Mercurius, Tert. ad. Nat. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ignitus: <entryFree id="n21407" type="main" key="igni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ignio.</entryFree>
ignivagus: <entryFree id="n21408" type="main" key="igni^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-vagor</etym>, <sense id="n21408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spreading like fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like wild-fire</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 896</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignivomus: <entryFree id="n21409" type="main" key="igni^vo^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignĭvŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignis-vomo</etym>, <sense id="n21409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vomiting fire</hi> (late Lat.): sol, Lact. (Venant.) Serm. de Resurr. Dom. 3.</sense></entryFree>
ignobilis: <entryFree id="n21410" type="main" key="igno_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-nobilis (gno-)</etym>, <sense id="n21410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unknown.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21410.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen. (mostly anteclass.): ubi ego Sosia nolim esse, tu esto sane Sosia; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, quando ego sum, vapulabis, ni hinc abis, ignobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hic est qui oculis meis ob viam ignobilis obicitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrina facies hominis atque ignobilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21410.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n21410.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unknown to fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not renowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undistinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod inglorius sit atque ignobilis ad supremum diem perventurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis in plebe et ideo ignobilis puerpera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ignobilis dicendi magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:315" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobilis aevum exigeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <trans><tr>unknown</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobilissimi artifices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: civitas ignobilis atque humilis Eburonum, <hi rend="ital">obscure and insignificant</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum ignobilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 20, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Fulcinius Romae argentariam non ignobilem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21410.4" n="B" level="2"> <cb n="IGNO" /> <hi rend="ital">Of low birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignoble</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliqua familia non ignobili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Tulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic novus Arpinas, ignobilis et modo Romae municipalis eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:287" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 287</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōbĭlĭter</orth> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepultum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes fastigiata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 56, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignobilitas: <entryFree id="n21411" type="main" key="igno_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ignobilis</etym>. <sense id="n21411.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur ignobilitas aut humilitas aut etiam popularis offensio sapientem beatum esse prohibebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21411.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Low birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean origin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21411.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multis viris fortibus ne ignobilitas generis obiceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc propter ignobilitatem paternam minus suspecto, Platorem occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21411.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">inferior quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignobiliter: <entryFree id="n21412" type="main" key="igno_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ignobilis <sense id="n21412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ignominia: <entryFree id="n21413" type="main" key="igno_mi^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōmĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in - nomen; qs. a deprivation of one's good name, of one's honor as a citizen</etym>, <sense id="n21413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignominy</hi>, esp. as the result of civil or military punishment (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf.: infamia, dedecus, probrum, opprobrium). </sense><sense id="n21413.1" n="I" level="1"> A legal and military term: censoris judicium nihil fere damnato nisi ruborem affert. Itaque, ut omnis ea judicatio versatur tantummodo in nomine, animadversio illa ignominia dicta est, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 9 sq.</bibl> (Rep. 4, 6 Mos.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu non animadvertes in omnes, sed carpes ut velis, et paucos ex multis ad ignominiam sortiere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiae causa post omnes interrogatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullos signiferos ignominiā notavit ac loco movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ignominiā notandos censuerunt eos, si qui militiam subterfugissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille milites, quia serum auxilium post proelium venerant, prope cum ignominia dimissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ignominia domum reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 101, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 8 al.</bibl>: ignominiae aut poenae causa ab urbe Roma abesse, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus, quibus damnatus unusquisque ignominia notatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:60" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne laboret ignominia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 182</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis ignominiis afficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadversionum et ignominiarum genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21413.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n21413.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: maculam atque ignominiam imponere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (civitatibus) expetunt laudem optimi et decus ignominiam fugiunt ac dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 20, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per summam injuriam ignominiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam sine ignominia imponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec insignis ignominia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiā mortuum afficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecta quibusdam ignominia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad depellendam ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbanas tribus transferri ignominiae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior omni vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:210" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 210</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines castigationibus, reprehensionibus, ignominiis affici se in delicto dolerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciis ignominiisque concisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21413.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac tamen una plaga conciderit, ignominia senatus,</quote> <trans><tr>a disgrace inflicted by the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labes ignominiaque mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominia amissarum navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 100 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summa ignominia familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignominiatus: <entryFree id="n21414" type="hapax" key="igno_mi^ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōmĭnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignominia</etym>, <sense id="n21414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgraced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 8, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ignominiose: <entryFree id="n21415" type="main" key="igno_mi^ni^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōmĭnĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ignominiosus.</entryFree>
ignominiosus: <entryFree id="n21416" type="main" key="igno_mi^ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōmĭnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignominia</etym>, <sense id="n21416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignominious</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n21416.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">exsul eras, ignominiosus,</quote> <trans><tr>branded with public ignominy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid eos qui huic ignominioso agmini fuere obvii, existimasse putatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam judiciis damnati ignominiosi fiunt, velut furti, vi bonorum raptorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:182" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 182</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōmĭnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="IGNO" /> <hi rend="ital">person branded with ignominy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one publicly disgraced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec concilium inire ignominioso fas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:77" default="NO">77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:3" default="NO">7, 5, 3</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiosis notas dempsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21416.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiosissimum caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 15</bibl></cit>: ignominiosa et flagitiosa dominatio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta (with immunda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 247</bibl></cit>: missio, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful dismissal</hi> (of a soldier), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōmĭnĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ignominiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgracefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hominibus magis nullis ignominiosius eos tractari, quam a vobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 147</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiosissime fugere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ignorabilis: <entryFree id="n21417" type="main" key="igno_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ignoro</etym>, <sense id="n21417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (rare but class.): separare, quod levius, facilius, non ignorabile, non fortuitum, non necessarium fuerit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri litteris ignorabilibus praenotati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum illud ignorabilius obscuriusque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 4</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 18</bibl>, false reading for ignobilis).— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an unknown manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laminae ignorabiliter litteratae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>covered with unknown characters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignorans: <entryFree id="n21418" type="main" key="igno_rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ignoro.</entryFree>
ignoranter: <entryFree id="n21419" type="main" key="igno_ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ignoro, <sense id="n21419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ignorantia: <entryFree id="n21420" type="main" key="igno_ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ignorans, from ignoro</etym>, <sense id="n21420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of knowledge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">information</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; only once in Cic., for <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl>, is a gloss; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Klotz,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>; syn. ignoratio). </sense><sense id="n21420.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: ignorantia loci, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 68, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discriminis sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteritae culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21420.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: errorem et temeritatem et ignorantiam et opinationem et suspicionem ... a virtute sapientiaque removebat, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Acc. 1, 11, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est maximum ignorantiae malum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:34" default="NO">5, 10, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:14" default="NO">7, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutua ignorantia fallentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancta ignorantia, quid sit illud quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantiā lapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:97:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 97, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si debitor meus manumisso dispensatori meo per ignorantiam solverit, liberari eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:160" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignoratio: <entryFree id="n21421" type="main" key="igno_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ignoro</etym>, <sense id="n21421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of knowledge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acquaintance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi> (freq. in Cic.; elsewh. rare). </sense><sense id="n21421.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timentibus ceteris propter ignorationem locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">numquam antea visi regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis et generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:22:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 22, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximarum rerum (with summus error),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:39:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 39, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21421.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus scientiam de omnibus constat fuisse, ejus ignoratio de aliquo purgatio debet videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ignoro: <entryFree id="n21422" type="main" key="igno_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form of <sense id="n21422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> ignorarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 38</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ignarus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not to know</hi> (a person or thing), <hi rend="ital">to have no knowledge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be unacquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be ignorant of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mistake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misunderstand</hi> (a person or thing—class.; cf. nescio).—Constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21422.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem istius regis (Anci) matrem habemus, ignoramus patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erras si id credis et me ignoras, Clinia,</quote> <trans><tr>do not know me</tr>, <tr>mistake me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti te ignorabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illum ignorabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illum et me vehementer ignoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exercitu tirone, ignoto adhuc duci suo ignorantique ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 18: illi iniqui jus ignorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec ignoremus, multa nobis et magna ignoranda sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam voluptatem Epicurus ignorat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tu quidem minime omnium ignoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 68, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoro causam (belli), detestor exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, ignoro pristina furta tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus astrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be</hi> <pb n="882" /> <cb n="IGNO" /> <hi rend="ital">known</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recognized</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoratur parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitive, etiam nunc credis, te ignorarier?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciscitantes quisnam esset, nam ignorabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoratus Romanos palantes repente aggreditur,</quote> <trans><tr>unknown</tr>, <tr>undiscovered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servili habitu per tenebras ignoratus evasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia ignorari possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archimedis ignoratum a Syracusanis indagavi sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Octavii eloquentia, quae fuerat ante consulatum ignorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ignoratae premit artis crimine turpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 262</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">to be changed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguised</hi>: pallam illam ad phrygionem ut referas, ut reconcinnetur.... <hi rend="ital">Men.</hi> Hercle; <cit><quote lang="la">eādem ea ignorabitur, ne uxor cognoscat te habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse eam dices faxo: ita ignorabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21422.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ignorabat, Q. Pompeium fecisse foedus, eādem in causā esse Mancinum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. § 1: neque ignoro, toto illo tempore vix tantum effici, quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 78</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illud ignoro, in iisdem fere esse et ornatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21422.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id quam vere fiat ignores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorante rege, uter eorum esset Orestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa vero sapientia, si se ignorabit, sapientia sit necne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ignoro, quanti ejus nomen putetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ignorans, quanta ex dissensionibus incommoda oriri consuessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid optandum foret ignorasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 103</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n21422.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorat etiam de filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ignorat quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 3, 8</bibl>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">an vero vos soli ignoratis? vos hospites in hac urbe versamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ego, si nequeo ignoroque, poëta salutor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nunc ignorans suo sibi servit patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 50</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiae causas ignorat dicere miles, Laetaturque tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 186</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21422.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take no notice of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay no attention to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregard</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mille modis amor ignorandust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum ego nec benevolentiam erga me ignorare, nec auctoritatem aspernare debeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tamen ignorat quid sidus triste minetur Saturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:569" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 569</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">not knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant of</hi> a thing (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ille, eventus belli non ignorans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignō-ranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoranter vel simpliciter non faciunt, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignoscens: <entryFree id="n21423" type="main" key="ignoscens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignoscens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ignosco.</entryFree>
ignoscentia: <entryFree id="n21424" type="main" key="ignoscenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignoscentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ignosco</etym>, <sense id="n21424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgiveness</hi> (post-class. and very rare).— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:47" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ignoscibilis: <entryFree id="n21425" type="main" key="ignosci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignoscĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excusable</hi> (post-class. and very rare): hic vester vestitus, Castrit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ignosco: <entryFree id="n21426" type="main" key="ignosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignosco</orth>, <itype>nōvi, nōtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n21426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plqpf. sync.</hi> ignosset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:619" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 619</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> ignosciturus, Piso Frugi ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 887</bibl>; Ambros. de Noë, 13, 47; also ignoturus, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 886</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. in-gnosco, nosco; lit., not to wish to know, not to search into; hence, with esp. reference to a fault or crime</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlook</hi> (class.; syn.: parco, indulgeo); constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, etc.), with simple <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21426.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ignoscant dii immortales, velim, et populo Romano et huic ordini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut eis delicta ignoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim mihi ignoscas, quod ad te scribo tam multa toties,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te peto ut mihi hoc ignoscas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi, quaeso, ignoscite, si appello talem virum saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne discamus nobis ignoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:29" default="NO">10, 3, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo familiare est hominibus, omnia sibi ignoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at vos vobis ignoscitis,</quote> <trans><tr>make excuses for</tr>, <tr>justify</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:181" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 181</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:189" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 189</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoscas velim huic festinationi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitiae meae et stultitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictis,</quote><bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (sc. factis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13</bibl></cit>, <cb n="ILE" /> 103 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignosci nobis postulabimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea jam aetate sum, ut non sit peccato mihi ignosci aequum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellam dedit, quia ignosceretur iis, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi profecto poterit ignosci, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">5: deprecatores, quibus non erat ignotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplis uti oportebit, quibus in simili excusatione non sit ignotum: et contentione, magis illis ignoscendum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21426.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With a simple <case>acc.</case> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): orant, ignoscamus peccatum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem istuc factum ignoscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvum si Tartara nossent Peccatum ignovisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 293</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego esse in hac re culpam meritam non nego, sed eam, quae sit ignoscenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cognoscendi et ignoscendi dabitur peccati locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21426.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignosce: orat, confitetur, purgat: quid vis amplius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens ignoscimus (in dicendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ejus facti deprecationem ignoscendi petenda venia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:37:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 37, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 41, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere fulmina pauper creditur atque deos, dis ignoscentibus ipsis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>conniving</tr>, <tr>winking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 146</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotum est, tacitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignoscens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">forgiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined to forgiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ignoscentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ignotus: <entryFree id="n21427" type="main" key="igno_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ignosco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21428" type="main" key="igno_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ignōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-gnotus, notus</etym>. <sense id="n21428.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21428.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ad ignotum arbitrum me appellis: si adhibebit fidem, Etsi est ignotus, notus: si non, notus ignotissimus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:104 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 104 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitabitis, judices, quin ab hoc ignotissimo Phryge nobilissimum civem vindicetis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoti homines et repentini quaestores celeriter facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ignotus et novus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos pluribus ignotissimi gentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinqua eoque ignotior gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedam in aciem adversus ignotos inter se ignorantesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 13: omnes illacrimabiles Urgentur ignotique longa Nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus applicationis obscurum sane et ignotum patefactum atque illustratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurioribus et ignotioribus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:74" default="NO">8, 6, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nova et ignota ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (dies) in vulgus ignotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille tibi non ignotus cursus animi mei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>unknown</tr>, <tr>distant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:39" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39</bibl>; cf.: nobilis ignoto diffusus consule Bacchus, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi> with respect to time, i. e. <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 379</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ignō-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is unknown.</hi>— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: ignoti nulla cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 397</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21428.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn. (for ignobilis, II.), <hi rend="ital">of low birth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgar</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quo patre sit natus, num ignota matre inhonestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naso suspendis adunco Ignotos, ut me libertino patre natum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit> and 24: <cit><quote lang="la">Achivi,</quote> <trans><tr>the ignoble Greeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenuit tellus ignoto nomine Ligdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:670" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotis perierunt mortibus illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21428.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/gnwstos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">ignorant of</hi> (very rare for ignarus, insciens, inscitus): ignotae iteris sumus, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra ignotis nota faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producere ad ignotos (aliquem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 6, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotos fallit, notis est derisui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ignoti, faciem ejus cum intuerentur, contemnebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iguvium: <entryFree id="n21429" type="main" key="I_gu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īgŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n21429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Umbria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gubbio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl>, b, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:461" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 461</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īgŭ-vĭnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īgŭvīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 31</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iguini</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ile: <entryFree id="n21430" type="main" key="i_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĕum</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, usually <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (heterocl. <sense id="n21430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> ilio, in the pun with Ilio from Ilion, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 499</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> iliis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <hi rend="ital">that part of the abdomen<cb n="ILIC" />  which extends from the lowest ribs to the pubes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the groin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flank.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 216</bibl>;
