<bibl default="NO">12, 486</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 507</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 499</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilium vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere ilia,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw the flanks together</tr>, <tr>become broken-winded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 6, 15, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere ilia,</quote> <trans><tr>to burst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the entrails</hi> of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:45:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 45, 4</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21430.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The belly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">body</hi> of a vessel, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 141</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21430.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the private parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ileos: <entryFree id="n21431" type="greek" key="i_le^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĕos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)leo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a severe kind of colic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the iliac pains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 23, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:101 al" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 31, § 101 al.</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 13</bibl>, written as Greek, called intestinorum tormentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:138" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 138</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ilerda: <entryFree id="n21432" type="main" key="I^lerda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭlerda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Sicoris</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lerida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 41 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:261" default="NO" valid="yes">261</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭlerdenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilergavonenses: <entryFree id="n21433" type="main" key="Ilergavonenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilergavonenses</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Illurg-</orth>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60, 2</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilergāŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the sea-coast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the mouth of the Ebro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illurgavonensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Illurgavonenses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ilergetes: <entryFree id="n21434" type="main" key="Ilerge_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilergētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the north of the Iberus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:61" default="NO" valid="yes">61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 21</bibl>; 26, 49 al.</sense></entryFree>
ilex: <entryFree id="n21435" type="main" key="i_lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the holmoak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great scarlet oak</hi> (cf. quercus, aesculus, robur), Quercus ilex, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 8, 12, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 30, § 73</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 194 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 702</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 237</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor felix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus ilice pastus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with acorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:70:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 70, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ilia: <entryFree id="n21436" type="main" key="i^li^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. ile.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21437" type="main" key="I_li^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical name of</hi> Rhea Silvia, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Numitor and mother of Romulus and Remus</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 70</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 56 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:383" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">598</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21437.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ilia.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21437.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus Iliades Iliadesque Remus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus and Remus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21437.3" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Romulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 781</bibl> and 824.</sense></entryFree>
iliacus: <entryFree id="n21438" type="main" key="I_li^a^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Ilium, II. B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21439" type="main" key="i_li^a^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ileos</etym>, <sense id="n21439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the colic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:17:171" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 17, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:21:206" default="NO">3, 21, 206</bibl>: dolor, 3, 20, 195.—As <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">sufferers from colic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:173" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iliades: <entryFree id="n21440" type="main" key="I_li^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭădes</orth>, ae. <sense id="n21440.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, v. Ilium, II. D.—</sense><sense id="n21440.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Ilia</hi>, v. Ilia, II.</sense></entryFree>
ilias: <entryFree id="n21441" type="main" key="I_li^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Ilium, II. E.</entryFree>
iliberi: <entryFree id="n21442" type="main" key="Iliberi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iliberi</orth>, v. Illiberi.</entryFree>
ilicet: <entryFree id="n21443" type="main" key="i_li^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭcet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>i, root of īre, and licet; cf. scilicet and videlicet; lit., one may go; hence</etym>, <sense id="n21443.0" n="I. A." level="1"> In the oldest per. of the lang., a t. t. with which an assembly was dismissed when the business on hand was at an end, <hi rend="ital">you may go; it is over</hi>: semper ilicet finem rei significat, ut actum est. Sic judices de concilio dimittebantur, suprema dicta cum praeco pronunciasset ilicet, quod significat ire licet, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ter. Heaut. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 424</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">at the end of funeral ceremonies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 216</bibl></cit> and 231.—</sense><sense id="n21443.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21443.2" n="1" level="3"> (Ante-class. and rare.) Ilicet, <hi rend="ital">let us go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let us be gone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet: Quid hic conterimus operam frustra?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet parasiticae arti maxumam malam crucem,</quote> <trans><tr>the parasite's art may go and be hanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit> Brix.—</sense><sense id="n21443.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">All is over</hi>, to signify that any thing is lost or has failed (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet, mandata eri perierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">actum est, ilicet, me infelicem et scelestam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 30</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet, desine, jam conclamatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet, vadimonium ultro mihi facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21443.4" n="II" level="1"> Through the intermediate idea of hastening (cf.: ilico, extemplo; protinus, continuo, statim), <hi rend="ital">straightway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi> (ante - class. and in <pb n="883" /> <cb n="ILIU" /> Aug. poets): an tu eloquens ilicet, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 180</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugit ilicet ocior Euro, Speluncamque petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet ignis edax summa ad fastigia vento Volvitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet obruimur numero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 424</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 15</bibl> (dub.; Müll. si licet); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:92" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilicetum: <entryFree id="n21444" type="main" key="i_li^ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ilex</etym>, <sense id="n21444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grove of holmoaks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forest of oaks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 20</bibl>; Fest. s. v. tifata, p. 366 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
iliceus: <entryFree id="n21445" type="main" key="i_li^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of holm-oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. iligneus and ilignus.</sense></entryFree>
ilico: <entryFree id="n21446" type="main" key="i_li^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭco</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭco</orth>, Ritschl ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 7</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>in-loco</etym>, <sense id="n21446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in that very place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21446.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (anteclass.): his persuadent, ut ilico manerent: pars ilico manent, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 325, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manete ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 12" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> ib. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico habitato, Att. ib.: otiose nunc jam ilico hic consiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">sta ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21446.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n21446.3" n="A" level="2"> Ilico illo, <hi rend="ital">to that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thither</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 325, 5</bibl>; Turp. ap. Non. l. l. (Com. Fragm. v. 105 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n21446.4" n="B" level="2"> Of time, Engl. <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directly</hi> (class.; syn.: extemplo, repente, protinus, statim, continuo): regrediendum est ilico, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 325, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico ante ostium hic erimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 3" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ubi legati pertulere, Amphitruo e castris ilico Producit omnem exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque increpuit suspicio tumultus, artes ilico nostrae conticescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 10, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicone ad praetorem ire convenit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ilienses: <entryFree id="n21447" type="main" key="I_li^enses1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Ilium, II. C.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21448" type="main" key="Ili^enses2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Sardinia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regarded by Mela as the earliest inhabitants of the island</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iligneus: <entryFree id="n21449" type="main" key="i_ligne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlignĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ilex</etym>, <sense id="n21449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of holmoak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. iliceus and ilignus.</sense></entryFree>
ilignus: <entryFree id="n21450" type="main" key="i_lignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of holm-oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit> (al. iligneis): <cit><quote lang="la">canalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 330</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ilion: <entryFree id="n21451" type="main" key="I_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, v. Ilium.</entryFree>
iliona: <entryFree id="n21452" type="main" key="I_li^o^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ilio/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n21452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eldest daughter of Priam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Polymnestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a king in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 653</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 109" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:240" default="NO">240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:243" default="NO">243</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 88</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The title of a tragedy by Pacuvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl>; and see the fragments, Trag. Rel. p. 100 sq. Rib.</sense></entryFree>
ilioneus: <entryFree id="n21453" type="main" key="I_li^o^neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭŏneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ilioneu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n21453.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The youngest son of Niobe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 261</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21453.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a follower of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 521</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilios: <entryFree id="n21454" type="main" key="Ilios"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilios</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Ilium.</entryFree>
iliosus: <entryFree id="n21455" type="main" key="i_li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. ilia</etym>, <sense id="n21455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who suffers with the colic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilipa: <entryFree id="n21456" type="main" key="Ilipa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilipa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Hispania Bœtica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the right bank of the Bœtis</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Guadalquiver</hi>), <hi rend="ital">its ruins near Peñaflor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilithyia: <entryFree id="n21457" type="main" key="I_li_thyia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlīthyia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ei)lei/quia</foreign> (the daughter of Juno), <sense id="n21457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of the Greeks who aided women in childbirth</hi>, Lat. Juno Lucina, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Carm. Sec. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 283</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 13, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilium: <entryFree id="n21458" type="main" key="I_li^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ilion</foreign>, <sense id="n21458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical name for</hi> Troja, <hi rend="ital">the city of Ilium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 408</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl> et saep.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)/ilios</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 467</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a later Ilium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built upon the coast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21458.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21458.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ilium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ilian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turmae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21458.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 52, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes Didus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:50" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesta,</quote> <trans><tr>worshipped at Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:227" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 227</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Alba, where also Vesta was worshipped,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 400</bibl></cit>: carmen, i. e. <cb n="ILLA" /> <hi rend="ital">Homer's Iliad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 129</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Macer,</quote> <trans><tr>a poet who wrote on the Trojan war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ganymede's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Phrygian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacoque jugum memorabile remo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the promontory of Misenum</tr>, <tr>where Misenus</tr>, <tr>a follower of Æneas</tr>, <tr>was drowned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 98</bibl></cit>: muri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Rome</hi>, as founded by descendants of the Trojan Æneas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:387" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 387</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, also, cuspis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the consul Flaminius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:595" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 595</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacos intra muros peccatur et extra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21458.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Ilium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ilians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21458.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ganymede</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 160</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21458.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n21458.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Trojan woman</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:371" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 371</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan women</hi> or <hi rend="ital">girls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 580</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21458.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The celebrated epic poem that describes the Trojan war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Iliad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 414</bibl>. —On account of its great extent, used fig. to represent a great quantity or number, <hi rend="ital">an Iliad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whole Iliad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 33</bibl>; cf. written as Greek: tanta malorum impendet <foreign lang="greek">*)ilia/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 3</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc vero longas condimus Iliadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n21459" type="main" key="ilium2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ilium</orth>, v. ile.</entryFree>
ilius: <entryFree id="n21460" type="main" key="Ilius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Ilium, II. A.</entryFree>
illa: <entryFree id="n21461" type="main" key="illa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illa</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ille <sense id="n21461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illabefactus: <entryFree id="n21462" type="main" key="illa^be^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăbĕfactus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-labefactus</etym>, <sense id="n21462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpaired</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illabor: <entryFree id="n21463" type="main" key="illa_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illābor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>psus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n21463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [inlabor], <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glide</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flow into; to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n21463.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (i. e. in stomachum) primo illabuntur ea, quae accepta sunt ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antennis illabitur ebria serpens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Stil. 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae jugis illabitur Aetnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fractus illabatur orbis,</quote> <trans><tr>should fall in</tr>, <tr>tumble to ruins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepet illabentibus astris Pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:138" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus fervor, per pingues unguine taedas illapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:427" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugis illabi lacrimis, unique paratum scire rogum,</quote> <trans><tr>to sink down dying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua Nar Tiberino illabitur amni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 475</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21463.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flow into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ea sola voluptas esset, quae quasi titillaret sensus, ut ita dicam, et ad eos cum suavitate afflueret et illaberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensim pernicies illapsa civium in animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da, pater, augurium, atque animis illabere nostris,</quote> <trans><tr>enter into our minds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis illapsa voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:95" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 95</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 400</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illaboratus: <entryFree id="n21464" type="main" key="illa^bo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăbōrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-laboratus</etym>, <sense id="n21464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not labored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquired without labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio (with simplex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus (with obvia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia fluunt illaborata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illaboro: <entryFree id="n21465" type="hapax" key="illa^bo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăbōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-laboro</etym>, <sense id="n21465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to work upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illaborare domibus (i. e. aedificandis),</quote> <trans><tr>to work at building houses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
illac: <entryFree id="n21466" type="main" key="illac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illac</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. illic <sense id="n21466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illacerabilis: <entryFree id="n21467" type="hapax" key="illa^ce^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăcĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lacerabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be torn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illacessitus: <entryFree id="n21468" type="main" key="illa^cessi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăcessītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inlacessitus</etym>, <sense id="n21468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unprovoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattacked</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">marcentem diu pacem illacessiti nutrierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illacrimabilis: <entryFree id="n21469" type="main" key="illa^cri^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăcrĭmābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lacrimabilis</etym>. <sense id="n21469.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unwept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlamented</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/klaustos</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed omnes illacrimabiles Urgentur ignotique longa Nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 26</bibl></cit> (cf. indefletus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 611</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n21469.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is not</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cannot be moved by tears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitiless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 36, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illacrimo: <entryFree id="n21470" type="main" key="illa^cri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăcrĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">illăcrĭmor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>in-lacrimo</etym>, <sense id="n21470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weep at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to bewail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n21470.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21470.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam de Socrate? cujus morti illacrimari soleo Platonem legens?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl></cit>: perge, aude, nate; <cit><quote lang="la">illacrima patris pestibus, id. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 21: casu (i. e. casui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: qui meo infelici errori unus <cb n="ILLA" /> illacrimasti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 15</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n21470.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusque mortem illacrimatum Alexandrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21470.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n21470.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Milo) aspexisse lacertos suos dicitur illacrimansque dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparge, et si paulum potes, illacrimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illacrimasse dicitur gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21470.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of things, <hi rend="ital">to weep</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et maestum illacrimat templis ebur aeraque sudant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 480</bibl></cit>; Col. poët. 10, 25; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi lumen refugiunt et illacrimant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illactenus: <entryFree id="n21471" type="main" key="illacte^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illactĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illatenus.</entryFree>
illaese: <entryFree id="n21472" type="main" key="illaese_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaesē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illaesus <sense id="n21472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illaesibilis: <entryFree id="n21473" type="main" key="illaesi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaesĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-laedo</etym>, <sense id="n21473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invulnerable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illaesus: <entryFree id="n21474" type="main" key="illaesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaesus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpaired</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">illaeso corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 826</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:489" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illaesus et indemnis evasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:536" default="NO">13, 536</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 27, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illaesē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without hurt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illaetabilis: <entryFree id="n21475" type="main" key="illaeta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaetābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-laetabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheerless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymen (with funestus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 861" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 861</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a dead child</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:633" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus (with grave),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 706</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illaevigatus: <entryFree id="n21476" type="main" key="illaevi^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaevĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. illevig.</entryFree>
illamentatus: <entryFree id="n21477" type="main" key="illa_menta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illāmentātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inlamentor</etym>, <sense id="n21477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmourned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlamented</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">illamentatus et insepultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illapsus: <entryFree id="n21478" type="main" key="illapsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illapsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from illabor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21479" type="main" key="illapsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illapsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>illabor</etym>, <sense id="n21479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gliding</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flowing in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris illapsus atque exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentino illapsu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregis illapsu fremebundo territus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illaqueatum: <entryFree id="n21480" type="main" key="illa^que^a_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăquĕātum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>alii pro vincto utuntur, alii pro soluto</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll.; cf. the foll. art.</entryFree>
illaqueo: <entryFree id="n21481" type="main" key="illa^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illăquĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inlaqueo</etym>, <sense id="n21481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ensnare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take in a snare</hi> (cf.: irretio, illigo, implico). * </sense><sense id="n21481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21481.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to entrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi> (very rare): cur illaquetur hic? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 7</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 85 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">munera navium Saevos illaqueant duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: illaqueatus jam omnium legum periculis, irretitus odio bonorum omnium, Auct. Harusp. Resp. 4, 7; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
illargio: <entryFree id="n21482" type="hapax" key="illargi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illargĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-largio</etym>, <sense id="n21482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow upon</hi>: pecuniam illargibo tibi, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illatabilis: <entryFree id="n21483" type="hapax" key="illa_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illātābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-latus</etym>, <sense id="n21483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without breadth</hi>, a word formed by Gellius to express the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)plath/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illatebro: <entryFree id="n21484" type="hapax" key="illa^te_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illătē^bro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-latebro</etym>, <sense id="n21484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hide in a corner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lurking-place</hi>: inermi illatebrant sese, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 3</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 129, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illatenus: <entryFree id="n21485" type="main" key="illa_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illātĕnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">illactĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>illetenus</etym>, <sense id="n21485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so far</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">navitas precum ejus (Arionis) commiseritum esse illactenus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras illatenus, qua dixi, legendas praebebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 326</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ter. Als. 4" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ter. Als. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illatio: <entryFree id="n21486" type="main" key="illa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infero</etym>, <sense id="n21486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing in</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n21486.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21486.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>burying</tr>, <tr>interment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:2:section=3 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 2, § 3 al.</bibl></cit>: FERRI, Inscr. ap. Marin. Fratr. Arv. 43.—</sense><sense id="n21486.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an impost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21486.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21486.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a causing</tr>, <tr>committing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21486.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a logical inference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel illativum rogamentum. quod ex acceptionibus colligitur et infertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3</bibl></cit>, pp. 34, 15.</sense></entryFree>
illativus: <entryFree id="n21487" type="main" key="illa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concluding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illative</hi> (cf. illatio, II. B.): particulae, Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 410</bibl> P.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illātīvum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">an inference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusion</hi>: universale, particulare, Apul. Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 34, 24. <pb n="884" /> <cb n="ILLE" /></sense></entryFree>
illatro: <entryFree id="n21488" type="main" key="illa_tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illātro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-latro</etym>, <sense id="n21488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bark at</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illatrat jejunis faucibus Orthrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:845" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 845</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illatus: <entryFree id="n21489" type="main" key="illa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infero.</entryFree>
illaudabilis: <entryFree id="n21490" type="main" key="illauda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaudābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-laudabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not worthy of praise</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illaudatus est quasi illaudabilis, qui neque mentione aut memoria ulla dignus neque umquam nominandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illaudandus: <entryFree id="n21491" type="hapax" key="illaudandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaudandus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inlaudo</etym>, <sense id="n21491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not praiseworthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta plebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illaudatus: <entryFree id="n21492" type="main" key="illauda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illaudātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not praised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpraised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21492.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gubernator illaudatus, inglorius subit portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:632" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 632</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 225</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n21492.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for illaudabilis, <hi rend="ital">unworthy of praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi>, = abominandus: <cit><quote lang="la">Busiris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 5</bibl></cit> Serv.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illautus: <entryFree id="n21493" type="main" key="illautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. illotus.</entryFree>
ille: <entryFree id="n21494" type="main" key="ille"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ille</orth> (old orthog., <orth extent="full" lang="la">olle</orth>), <itype>a, ud</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ollus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 42</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 197</bibl>; in dramat. poets often ĭlle, v. Corss. Ausspr. II. p. 624), <sense id="n21494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> illī^us (usu. illĭus in epic and lyric poets; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl>; illīus in the time of Quint; cf. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, 683 sqq.; 696; <hi rend="ital">gen. sing. m.</hi> illi, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing. f.</hi> olli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 254</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 153</bibl> and 154; <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> ‡ ab oloes = ab illis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 19</bibl> Müll.); <hi rend="ital">pron. demonstr.</hi> [Etym. dub., v. Corss. Beitr. p. 301], points (opp. hic) to something more remote, or which is regarded as more remote, and, in contrast with hic and iste, to something near or connected with a third person, <hi rend="ital">that; he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi> (<hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n21494.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n21494.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">substantives</hi>: ille vir haud magna cum re sed plenus fidei, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 342 Vahl.): si quid vos per laborem recte feceritis, labor ille a vobis cito recedet ... nequiter factum illud apud vos semper manebit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol me ille admonuit,</quote> <trans><tr>that sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illa tranquillitate atque otio jucundissime vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis arrogantia odiosa est, tum illa ingenii atque eloquentiae multo molestissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illa vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Aurora nitentem Luciferum portet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:93" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: illos bono genere gnatos, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ille, cives qui id cogit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ille, Non sum, inquit, nescius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ab Alexandrea discessisse nemo nuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de illius Alexandrea discessu nihil adhuc rumoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illi sanguinem nostrum largiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba erat negligentior, quam conveniret principi electo atque illud aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.4" n="B" level="2"> With other <hi rend="ital">pronouns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque cum primum audivi, ego ille ipse factus sum: scis quem dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum illis una ipsum illum Carneadem diligenter audierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille quoque ipse confessus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic illi legato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc illum fatis Portendi generum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 255</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est enim ille vultus semper idem quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est ille status quantitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est idem ille tyrannus deterrimum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem illam (sphaeram),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et idem qui consuerunt et idem illud alii desiderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum reliquit alterum apud matrem domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.5" n="C" level="2"> Opp. to hic, to indicate that object which is the more remote, either as regards the position of the word denoting it, or as it is conceived of by the writer; v. hic, I. D.—</sense><sense id="n21494.6" n="D" level="2"> Pleon., referring back to a subject or object already mentioned in the same sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">sic oculos, sic ille manus, sic ora ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 490</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille timidus perire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenides, Xenophanes, minus bonis quamquam versibus, sed tamen illi versibus increpant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21494.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21494.8" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, to indicate some well-known or celebrated object, equivalent to <hi rend="ital">the ancient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wellknown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the famous</hi>: si Antipater ille Sidonius, quem tu probe, Catule, meministi, <cb n="ILLE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xenophon, Socraticus ille,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor Panaetii illius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a qua (gratia) te flecti non magis potuisse demonstras, quam Herculem Xenophontium illum a voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex eodem Ponto Medea illa quondam profugisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno illi Alexandro simillimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum illud Solonis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.9" n="B" level="2"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n21494.10" n="a" level="4"> Hic ... ille, <hi rend="ital">this ... that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the one ... the other</hi>, of single objects in opp. to the whole: non dicam illinc hoc signum ablatum esse et illud; <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dico, nullum te Aspendi signum, Verres, reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.11" n="b" level="4"> Ille aut or et ille, <hi rend="ital">that or that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such and such</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesisse, num ille aut ille defensurus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendo vobis illum et illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.12" n="c" level="4"> Ille quidem ... sed (autem, etc.), <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, etc., ... <hi rend="ital">but still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi quidam, minime mali illi quidem, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludo autem et joco uti illo quidem licet, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Mucius enucleate ille quidem et polite, ut solebat, nequaquam autem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter bellum comparat, non injustum ille quidem, suis tamen civibus exitiabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi illud quidem, verum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 18, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.13" n="d" level="4"> Ex illo, <hi rend="ital">from that time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since then</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ex illo fluere et retro sublapsa referri Spes Danaūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 169</bibl></cit> (for which in full: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore jam ex illo casus mihi cognitus urbis Trojanae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 623</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">solis ex illo vivit in antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet ex illo Junonia permanet ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 85</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21494.14" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">illā</orth> (sc. viā=ab hac parte), <hi rend="ital">in that way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego me illa per posticum ad congerrones conferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac vel illa cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac ne pervium illa Germanicis exercitibus foret, obsaepserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum quin etiam Oceanum illa tentavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte revertebar festis vestalibus illa, qua, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:395" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 395</bibl></cit> Merk. (vulg. illac).—</sense><sense id="n21494.15" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">illō</orth> (sc. loco), <hi rend="ital">to that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thither</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21494.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with verbs of motion, = illuc: <cit><quote lang="la">principio ut illo advenimus, ubi primum terram tetigimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim temere praeter mercatores illo adit quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam illo non saxum, non materies advecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 328</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Vin' huc vocem? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Ego illo accessero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">positiones huc aut illo versae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21494.18" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To that end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia Caesar eodem illo pertinere arbitrabatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to that very purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.19" n="b" level="4"> Post-class. for ibi, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21494.20" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">illim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, an early form (cf.: istim, exim) for illinc (i. e. illim-ce), <hi rend="ital">from that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thence</hi> (ante-class. and a few times in Cic.): sarculum hinc illo profectus illim redisti rutrum, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 21</bibl> (Fragm. Com. v. 90 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:879" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 879</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illim equidem Gnaeum profectum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit> (al. illinc): <cit><quote lang="la">quid illim afferatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 13</bibl></cit>, b, 7 (al. illinc); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem se amorem abjecisse illim atque in hanc transfudisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Harusp. Resp. 20, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illecebra: <entryFree id="n21495" type="main" key="ille^ce^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕcĕbra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illicio</etym>, <sense id="n21495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enticement</hi>, in a good or bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an inducement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21495.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.;
