in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; a favorite word of Cic.; cf.: invitatio, invitamentum). </sense><sense id="n21495.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (subj. or obj.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae tanta in ullo homine juventutis illecebra fuit, quanta in illo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima est illecebra peccandi impunitatis spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas est illecebra turpitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallax illecebra admirationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet etiam amoenitas ipsa vel sumptuosas vel desidiosas illecebras multas cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum (with lenocinia cupiditatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21495.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditia illecebra animo est amantūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cb n="ILLI" /> ad quam illecebiam cum commoveretur nemo, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis te oportet illecebris ipsa virtus trahat ad verum decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocum tentavit, eo quod Illecebris erat et grata novitate morandus Spectator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 223</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21495.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n21495.5" n="A" level="2"> Of an alluring, seductive person, <hi rend="ital">an enticer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a decoy-bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21495.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> andrachne agria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:128" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 79, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illecebro: <entryFree id="n21496" type="main" key="ille^ce^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕcĕbro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>illecebra</etym>, <sense id="n21496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entice</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculos carnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 113" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illecebrose: <entryFree id="n21497" type="main" key="ille^ce^bro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕcĕbrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illecebrosus <sense id="n21497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illecebrosus: <entryFree id="n21498" type="main" key="ille^ce^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕcĕbrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>illecebra</etym>, <sense id="n21498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very enticing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seductive</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">istoc illecebrosius Fieri nihil potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕcĕ-brōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">enticingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractively.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 7</bibl></cit> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 36</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
illectamentum: <entryFree id="n21499" type="main" key="illecta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illectāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>illecto</etym>, <sense id="n21499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">means of allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lenonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 335, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 338, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illectatio: <entryFree id="n21500" type="main" key="illecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi> (post-class. and very rare, for the class. illecebra): <cit><quote lang="la">jucundae sermonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illectio: <entryFree id="n21501" type="main" key="illecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illicio</etym>, <sense id="n21501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandimentorum illectione seduco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 120, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illecto: <entryFree id="n21502" type="main" key="illecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illecto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illectus: <entryFree id="n21503" type="main" key="illectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from illicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21504" type="main" key="illectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lectus, from 2. lego</etym>. * <sense id="n21504.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not collected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not gathered together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipula illecta sunt spicae in messe dejectae necdum lectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:30:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 30, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21504.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not read</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unread</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si non accipiet scriptum illectumque remittet, Lecturam spera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 469</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21505" type="main" key="illectus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>illicio</etym>, <sense id="n21505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enticement</hi>, with a play upon the word lectus: <cit><quote lang="la">magis illectum tuum quam lectum metuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:17 al" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 17 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
illegitimus: <entryFree id="n21506" type="main" key="ille_gi^ti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illēgĭtĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n21506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlawful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not permitted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illēgĭtĭmē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illegitimately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui concipiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:section=89" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, § 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illepide: <entryFree id="n21507" type="main" key="ille^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illepidus <sense id="n21507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illepidus: <entryFree id="n21508" type="main" key="ille^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕpĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lepidus</etym>, <sense id="n21508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impolite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inamabilis, inlepidus vivo, Malevolente ingenio natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens avarus, illepidus, in liberos difficilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciae illepidae atque inelegantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum (with invenustum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba durae et illepidae novitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illĕpĭdē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">impolitely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istoc pacto tam lepidam inlepide appelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illevigatus: <entryFree id="n21509" type="hapax" key="ille_vi^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illēvĭgātus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">illaev-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-laevigatus</etym>, <sense id="n21509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus (with inconditus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 499</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
illex: <entryFree id="n21510" type="main" key="illex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ēgis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lex</etym>, <sense id="n21510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lawless</hi> (anteclass.); <cit><quote lang="la">as a term of reproach: impure, inhoneste, injure, inlex, labes popli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 10, 24</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 60 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21511" type="main" key="illex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illex</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">illix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>illicio</etym>, <sense id="n21511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alluring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enticing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seductive</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n21511.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">halitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psych. 328</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n21511.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst. com.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21511.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A decoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis nobis area'st, auceps sum ego, Esca'st meretrix, lectus illex est, amatores aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21511.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a seducer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seductress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae rei tantae fuimus illices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illex animi Venus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 295</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illi: <entryFree id="n21512" type="main" key="illi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. illic <sense id="n21512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illibabilis: <entryFree id="n21513" type="main" key="illi_ba_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illībābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-libo</etym>, <sense id="n21513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incapable<pb n="885" /> <cb n="ILLI" />  of diminution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illibatus: <entryFree id="n21514" type="main" key="illi_ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illībātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-libo</etym>, <sense id="n21514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undiminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpaired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): veteres illibataeque divitiae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (with integra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>complete</tr>, <tr>unabridged</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 497</bibl></cit> P.: potestas, Rescript. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera prisci tori,</quote> <trans><tr>unviolated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illiberalis: <entryFree id="n21515" type="main" key="illi_be^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illībĕrālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-liberalis</etym>, <sense id="n21515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unworthy of a freeman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignoble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungenerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sordid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disobliging</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly of things): illiberales et sordidi quaestus mercenariorum omnium, quorum operae, non quorum artes emuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex omnino est jocandi genus, unum illiberale, petulans, flagitiosum, obscenum: alterum elegans, urbanum, ingeniosum, facetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad cognoscendum non illiberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus (raphanus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servom haud illiberalem praebes te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te in me illiberalem putabit,</quote> <trans><tr>disobliging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21515.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Niggardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim illiberali adiectione ad centum talenta perductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14, 14</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illībĕrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ignobly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungenerously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum a vobis (with duriter immisericorditerque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me audiatis ut unum e togatis, patris diligentia non illiberaliter institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aestimare valde illiberaliter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>meanly</tr>, <tr>stingily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illiberalitas: <entryFree id="n21516" type="main" key="illi_be^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illībĕrālĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illiberalis</etym>, <sense id="n21516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conduct unworthy of a freeman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignoble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ungenerous behavior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinginess</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">habenda est ratio rei familiaris, sed ita, ut illiberalitatis avaritiaeque absit suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illiberaliter: <entryFree id="n21517" type="main" key="illi_be^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illībĕrālĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illiberalis <sense id="n21517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illiberi: <entryFree id="n21518" type="main" key="Illiberi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Illiberi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ili-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-erri</orth>), <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> (<gen>f.</gen> <case>acc.</case> -im, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 24, 3</bibl>), <sense id="n21518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Hispania Bœtica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Bœtis and the coast</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Granada</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illiberis: <entryFree id="n21519" type="main" key="illi_be^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illībĕris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-liberi</etym>, <sense id="n21519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illic: <entryFree id="n21520" type="main" key="illic1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illic</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">ollic</orth>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=196" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 196</bibl> Müll.), illaec, illuc, or illoc, <sense id="n21520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> [ille-ce]. </sense><sense id="n21520.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">it yonder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed Amphitruonis illic est servos Sosia, A portu illic nunc cum laterna huc advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 148 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 148 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis demiror, Sosia, Qui illaec (i. e. Alcumena) illi me donatum esse aurea patera sciat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio dare mercedem, qui illunc, ubi sit, commonstret mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde auscultare possis, quom ego illanc osculer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latuit intus illic in illac hirnea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 275</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illac impudente audacius?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid illuc est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc sis vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc est sapere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illoc pacisce, si potes: perge obsecro: Pacisce quidvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 29</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illic est scelus, qui me perdidit?</quote> <trans><tr>that scoundrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21520.2" n="B" level="2"> With the interrogative part. <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: illicine, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Illicine est? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Illic ipsus est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illancine mulierem alere cum illa familia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21520.3" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21520.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">illac</orth> (sc. viā), <hi rend="ital">that way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angiporto Illac per hortum circuit clam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nunc hac an illac eam, incerta sum consili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac atque illac perfluo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac illac circumcursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes damnatos, omnes ignominia adfectos illac facere,</quote> <trans><tr>stand on that side</tr>, <tr>belong to that party</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21520.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">illuc</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">illoc</orth> (the old form, like hoc for huc), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thither.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21520.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21520.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Form illuc: imus huc, illuc hinc; cum illuc ventum est, ire illinc lubet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 258 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clam illuc redeundum est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illuc veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: paulo momento<cb n="ILLI" />  huc illuc impelli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc illuc quasi vitabundi agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salientes huc illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">huc atque illuc intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc et illuc Cursitant mixtae pueris puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc ex his vinculis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into the other world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponimus illuc ire, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc, unde fugit mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 339</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21520.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Form illoc: <cit><quote lang="la">post illoc veni quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illoc advenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit> (dub.; Fleck. illo).—</sense><sense id="n21520.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to that person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereto</hi> (very rare): <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Illuc redi. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Quo redeam? <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Equidem ad phrygionem censeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo res haec pertinet? illuc: Dum vitant stulti vitia, in contraria currunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc, unde abii, redeo: Nemon' ut avarus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc cuncta vergere,</quote> <trans><tr>to Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21520.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To that point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a pitch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc adversis urgentibus, illuc decidit ut malum ferro summitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21521" type="main" key="illic2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illic</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">illi</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 251</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17</bibl> Rib.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 548</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 36</bibl> Donat. ad loc.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. illic</etym>, <sense id="n21521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yonder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi> (most. freq. ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n21521.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec illi vi pugnata pugnast usque a mane ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 261</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 3, 36: illic sum atque hic sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive illic sive alibi libebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo melius, hic quae fiunt, quam illic, ubi sum adsidue, scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendum est illic, ubi nulla incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic, quicquid ero, semper tua dicar imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:13" default="NO">13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives Romani, qui illic negotiarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic radices, illic fundamenta sunt, illic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21521.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with that person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (very rare): non isto vivitur illic, Quo tu rere, modo, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with Mœcenas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civile bellum a Vitellio coepit et ... initium illic fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic, ubi opus est, non verentur: illic, ubi nihil opus est, ibi verentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21521.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In that matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therein</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica et milite illic et pecunia vacet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in that war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illi maxumam partem fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illic me autem sic adsimulabam quasi stolidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illicibilis: <entryFree id="n21522" type="main" key="illi^ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>illicio</etym>, <sense id="n21522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seductive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
illicine: <entryFree id="n21523" type="main" key="illicine"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illicine</orth>, v. 1. illic, I. B.</entryFree>
illicio: <entryFree id="n21524" type="main" key="illi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>lexi, lectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n21524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf. sync.</hi> illexe, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 68</bibl>; Fragm. Trag. v. 205 Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 45</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-lacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decoy</hi> (most freq. in a bad sense; allicere oftenest in a good sense; cf.: invito, prolecto, inesco; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; perh. only once in Cic.; not in Cæs.): qui non sat habuit conjugem illexe in stuprum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 68</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 137 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">is me ad illam illexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines mente alienatos ad se (hyaena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ad bellum spes rapinarum illexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad proditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illectus praemio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 97:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 97, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallorum fraude illectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam illud par in utroque nostrum, quod ab eisdem illecti sumus,</quote> <trans><tr>misled</tr>, <tr>led astray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere, ne illiciaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invexisse in Galliam vinum, inliciendae gentis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inlicite lucro mercatorem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietos Inlicere, ut cuperent vitam mutare priorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 169</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inescandae illiciendaeque multitudinis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars dialectica utilis saepe illiciendo, implicando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: saltus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to surround with nets</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 6, 18</bibl> dub. (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 32</bibl> conject.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimen alios in saltus inlicite). —In a good sense: ut populus illiciatur ad magistratus conspectum,</quote> <trans><tr>be summoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 94</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
illicitator: <entryFree id="n21525" type="main" key="illi^ci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭtātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>in-licito</etym>, <sense id="n21525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who bids at an auction to make others bid higher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sham-bidder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mock-purchaser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illicitatorem venditor, non, qui contra liceatur, emptor apponet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; <cb n="ILLI" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quoniam tuum pretium novi, il. licitatorem potius ponam quam illud minoris veneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit> (explained, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl>: illicitator emptor, erroneously).</sense></entryFree>
illicite: <entryFree id="n21526" type="main" key="illi^ci^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illicitus <sense id="n21526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illicitus: <entryFree id="n21527" type="main" key="illi^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-licitus</etym>, <sense id="n21527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not allowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlawful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illegal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illicit</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammis arsere senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <trans><tr>by which it is forbidden to go</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas temerare rudentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 627</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ire per illicitum pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per licita et illicita foedatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: lampas caeli, <hi rend="ital">lightning</hi> (because what was struck by it was not allowed to be touched), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:470" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 470</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 599" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 599</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 360" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 360</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 61, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.—Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res illicitissima atque indignissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 202" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 202</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a forbidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unlawful manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illegally</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:11:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 11, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare praedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 16, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
illicium: <entryFree id="n21528" type="main" key="illi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>illicio</etym>, <sense id="n21528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which entices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inducement</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n21528.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si transiturae sunt apes, alvearia apiastro perfricanda, quod illicium hoc illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 22</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:31" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21528.2" n="II" level="1"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">a calling together of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 94</bibl> Müll.; cf. Fest. s. h. v. p. 113, 3 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
illico: <entryFree id="n21529" type="main" key="illico"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illico</orth>, v. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ilico</orth>.</entryFree>
illido: <entryFree id="n21530" type="main" key="illi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-laedo</etym>, <sense id="n21530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beat against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat</hi> in any direction. </sense><sense id="n21530.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, not in Cic. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incutio, impingo, infligo): libravit caestus effractoque illisit in ossa cerebro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 480</bibl></cit>: ad vulnus manus, Cic. poët. Tusc. 3, 31, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repagula ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funale fronti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem fragili (corpori),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbissimos vultus solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum illisum crebro silici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus se illidit in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: quos Rex suus illisit pelago, <hi rend="ital">drove to the sea</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forced to navigate the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:52" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidos illidit in aegrum Cornipedem cursus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>guides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:517" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 517</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21530.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash to pieces</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illisis cruribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens compressa atque illisa morietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
illigamentum: <entryFree id="n21531" type="main" key="illi^ga_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭgāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>illigo</etym>, <sense id="n21531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligament</hi> (late Lat.): femineis tegminum illigamentis capita velare, Salvian. Gub. D. 7, p. 284 Rittersh.</sense></entryFree>
illigatio: <entryFree id="n21532" type="main" key="illi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastening</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nodorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterna circulorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illigo: <entryFree id="n21533" type="main" key="illi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n21533.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inque ligatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 794</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-ligo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bind on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21533.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21533.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">emblemata ita scite in aureis poculis illigabat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae in jaculo illigatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo (corpore) influente atque effluente animi divini ambitus illigabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: cum Archimedes lunae, solis, quinque errantium motus in sphaeram illigavit, <hi rend="ital">attached</hi> or <hi rend="ital">added to the celestial globe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in currus distentum illigat Metium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencis illigata aratra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauris juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illigata tigna tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus post tergum illigatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem laxis vesicis illigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel cum elaterio umbilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 58, § 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21533.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., with the idea of hinderance to free motion predominating, <hi rend="ital">to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encumber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: illaqueo, irretio, implico; <cit><quote lang="la">impedio): inutilis inque ligatus Cedebat clipeoque inimicum hastile trahebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10</bibl></cit> 794: <cit><quote lang="la">se impeditis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres viscatis illigatae viminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illigatus praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veneno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21533.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21533.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to attach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(paeon) quam commodissime putatur in solutam orationem illigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:215" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 215</bibl></cit>: orationis genus, in quo <pb n="886" /> <cb n="ILLI" /> omnes verborum illigantur lepores, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonibus ejusmodi personas tam graves illigare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non iis condicionibus illigabitur pax, ut movere bellum possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21533.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, in a good or bad sense; <hi rend="ital">to oblige</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold bound; to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encumber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis et multis pignoribus M. Lepidum res publica illigatum tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiari amicitia illigati Philippo erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos praeceptis illigaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sociali foedere se cum Romanis non illigarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illigari bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustis et concisis disputationibus illigati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix illigatum te triformi Pegasus expediet Chimaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illim: <entryFree id="n21534" type="main" key="illim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ille <sense id="n21534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 3.</sense></entryFree>
illimatus: <entryFree id="n21535" type="hapax" key="illi_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīmātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-limus</etym>, <sense id="n21535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fastened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attached by means of rich earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illimis: <entryFree id="n21536" type="hapax" key="illi_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīmis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slime</hi>: fons, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidus, purus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illimitatus: <entryFree id="n21537" type="main" key="illi_mi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>in-limito</etym>, <sense id="n21537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlimited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 20.</sense></entryFree>
illinc: <entryFree id="n21538" type="main" key="illinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illinc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for illim-ce</etym>, <sense id="n21538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21538.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube illos illinc abscedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illinc venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se illinc subducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illinc huc transferetur virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illinc pallium mihi huc ferte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illinc equidem Gnaeum profectum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator utrimque hinc et illinc Jovi Vota suscipere,</quote> <trans><tr>here and there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et hinc et illinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21538.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">from that person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from that quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on that side</hi>: habeo pro meis, nec manu adseruntur; <cit><quote lang="la">neque illinc partem quisquam postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illinc beneficium non sit, rectius putem quidvis domi perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: illinc omnes praestigiae; <cit><quote lang="la">illinc omnes fallaciae: omnia denique ab his mimorum argumenta nata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. hinc: illinc cornicines, hinc praecedentia longi agminis officia,</quote> <trans><tr>on one side ... on the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illinimentum: <entryFree id="n21539" type="main" key="illi^ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭnīmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>illinio</etym>, <sense id="n21539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besmearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anointing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:section=132" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illinio: <entryFree id="n21540" type="main" key="illi^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n21540.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
illino: <entryFree id="n21541" type="main" key="illi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>lēvi, lĭtum, 3</itype> (also acc. to the 4th conj.: <sense id="n21541.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">illinire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 65</bibl>; but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 191</bibl>, and 32, 10, 51, § 140, where the correct read. is illinunt and illini, v. Sillig. ad h. ll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-lino</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to put on by smearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spreading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay on</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n21541.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis collyria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papavera madefacta teneris genis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">psyllion fronti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 12, 91, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anisum recens phreneticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solani folia contrita et illita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum vestibus illitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum marmori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 20, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces taedamque et malleolos stuppae inlitos pice parari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si bruma nives Albanis illinet agris,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque semel chartis illeverit,</quote> <trans><tr>has written</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21541.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21541.3" n="A" level="2"> Aliquid aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedaub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anoint</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem alicui fimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 14, 58, § 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8, 21, § 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adustas gingivas melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">texta Nesseo veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula ceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces taedamque et malleolos pice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces galbano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem bitumine ac sulphure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticum Medis,</quote> <trans><tr>to paint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 382</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n21541.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venustatis, non fuco illitus, sed sanguine diffusus color,</quote> <trans><tr>daubed over with paint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum inimicorum veneno illitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita illita maculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:43" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illiquefactus: <entryFree id="n21542" type="hapax" key="illi^que^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭquĕfactus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [in-liquefacio], <sense id="n21542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam illiquefactae voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illiquor: <entryFree id="n21543" type="hapax" key="illi_quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīquor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n21543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [in-liquor], <cb n="ILLU" /> <hi rend="ital">to flow into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis (cochleis) de caelo nihil illiquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:27" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illisio: <entryFree id="n21544" type="main" key="illi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illido</etym>, <sense id="n21544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dashing against</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scopulorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:65" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illisus: <entryFree id="n21545" type="main" key="illi_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from illido.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21546" type="main" key="illi_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>illido</etym>, <sense id="n21546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dashing against</hi> (only in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:246" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illisu repercussus ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 48, 49, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illitteratus: <entryFree id="n21547" type="main" key="illitte^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illittĕrātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">illītĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-litteratus</etym>. <sense id="n21547.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unlettered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illiterate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneducated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlearned</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem cognovimus virum bonum et non illitteratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus illitteratusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illitteratum dicimus non ex toto rudem, sed ad litteras altiores non perductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also of one who cannot read,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —Of things, <hi rend="ital">unlearned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidunt in sermone vario multa, quae fortasse illis cum dixi nec illitterata nec insulsa esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribo plurimas sed illitteratissimas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21547.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unwritten</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not drawn up in writing</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/grafos</foreign> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tacito illitteratoque Atheniensium consensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: illitterata pax est, quae litteris comprehensa non est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n21547.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inarticulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <trans><tr>interjections</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1024</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 537</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
illitus: <entryFree id="n21548" type="main" key="illi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from illino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21549" type="main" key="illi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>illino</etym>, <sense id="n21549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bedaubing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anointing</hi> with medicaments (only in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:217" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 15, 61, § 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illix: <entryFree id="n21550" type="main" key="illix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. 2. illex.</entryFree>
illo: <entryFree id="n21551" type="main" key="illo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ille <sense id="n21551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illoc: <entryFree id="n21552" type="main" key="illoc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illoc</orth>. <sense id="n21552.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. pron.</hi>, v. illic.—</sense><sense id="n21552.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, v. illic <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illocabilis: <entryFree id="n21553" type="main" key="illo^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illŏcābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-loco</etym>, <sense id="n21553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot</hi> (<hi rend="ital">on account of her poverty</hi>) <hi rend="ital">be disposed of in marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem habeo grandem, dote cassam atque illocabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 14</bibl> Müll.); Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illocalis: <entryFree id="n21554" type="main" key="illo^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illŏcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-loco</etym>, <sense id="n21554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not fixed in any place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">illŏ-cālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">independently of place</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illorsum: <entryFree id="n21555" type="main" key="illorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illorsum</orth> <itype>et aliorsum sicut introrsum dixit Cato</itype> (<sense id="n21555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thitherwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thither</hi>), Paul. ex Fest. s. v. aliorsum, p. 27 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
