illotus: <entryFree id="n21556" type="main" key="illo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illōtus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">illautus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">illūtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lotus</etym>, <sense id="n21556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwashed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncleaned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21556.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21556.2" n="a" level="4"> </sense><sense id="n21556.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form illotus: <cit><quote lang="la">illotis manibus aliquid tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">echini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 16, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 2, 31, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inlotus sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 443</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n21556.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form illautus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21556.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Form illutus: <cit><quote lang="la">vinacei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21556.6" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">illotis manibus or pedibus facere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to underlake a thing without due preparation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5" default="NO">17, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 24, § 12</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n21556.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: illotus sermo, Auct. Decl. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> 1, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illubricans: <entryFree id="n21557" type="hapax" key="illu_bri^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūbrĭcans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [inlubrico], <sense id="n21557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moving in a slippery manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra sua leniter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuc: <entryFree id="n21558" type="main" key="illuc1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illuc</orth>, <sense id="n21558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>, v. 1. illic.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n21559" type="main" key="illuc2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illuc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. illic, II. B.</entryFree>
illuceo: <entryFree id="n21560" type="main" key="illu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūcĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-luceo</etym>, <sense id="n21560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to light up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illuminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give light</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pix atra tuo capiti illuceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus tua veri fulgore solis illuceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 19, 39.</sense></entryFree>
illucesco: <entryFree id="n21561" type="main" key="illu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūcesco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">illūcisco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>luxi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n21561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-lucesco]. </sense><sense id="n21561.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, of the day or of the sun, <hi rend="ital">to grow light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dawn</hi> (most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n21561.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21561.3" n="1" level="3"> Illucescet ille aliquando dies, cum tu, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (dies) ut illuxit, mortui sunt reperti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hic tibi dies inluxit lucrificabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: pro di immortales, quis hic illuxit dies? Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 431</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 30</bibl>; id. <cb n="ILLU" /> Ac. 2, 22, 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl>: ea nocte, cui illuxit dies caedis, <hi rend="ital">on which arose the day</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tertio die sol illuxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illucescerent elementa mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21561.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: illuxit, <hi rend="ital">it was light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">day had dawned</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.; perh. not in Cæs.; for in B. C. 1, 23, 1, luxit is the better reading; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Oud. ad loc.): ubi illuxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 65, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21561.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum populo Romano vox et auctoritas consulis repente in tantis tenebris illuxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimum deinde Homeri illuxit ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem si illuxerit, non universa pretia in patrimonium tuum processisse,</quote> <trans><tr>shall be made clear</tr>, <tr>apparent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 71, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21561.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give light to</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">(nox) ut mortales illucescas luce clara et candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestiorem nullum alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuctans: <entryFree id="n21562" type="main" key="illuctans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illuctans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [in-luctor], <sense id="n21562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">struggling in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditans verba illuctantia labris,</quote> <trans><tr>struggling against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:790" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 790</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illucubratus: <entryFree id="n21563" type="main" key="illu_cubra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūcubrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lucubratus</etym>, <sense id="n21563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not composed by night</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not elaborated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">illucubrata atque impolita scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Ep. ad Bass. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuculasco: <entryFree id="n21564" type="hapax" key="illu_cu^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūcŭlasco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n21564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-luceo], of the day, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum serenus dies illuculascet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 5</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
illudia: <entryFree id="n21565" type="main" key="illu_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūdĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>illudo</etym>, <sense id="n21565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">illusions</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Resurr. Carn. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illudio: <entryFree id="n21566" type="main" key="illu_dio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūdio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, v. illudo.</entryFree>
illudium: <entryFree id="n21567" type="main" key="illu_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-ludium</etym>, <sense id="n21567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mockery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Resurr. Carn. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illudo: <entryFree id="n21568" type="main" key="illu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (acc. to the first conj. illudiabant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <sense id="n21568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> inlusseris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl> Bait., Lahm.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-ludo]. </sense><sense id="n21568.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to play at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to sport with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amuse one's self with</hi> (syn. colludo; cf. ludificor). </sense><sense id="n21568.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illudo chartis,</quote> <trans><tr>amuse myself with writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima videbatur talis illudere palla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21568.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn. </sense><sense id="n21568.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make sport</hi> or <hi rend="ital">game of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mock</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">jeer at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ridicule</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21568.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne plane videaris hujus miseri fortunis et horum virorum talium dignitati illudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semper gaudes illudere rebus Humanis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illudere capto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimini publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inlusit Neroni fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 72</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n21568.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te pro istis factis ulciscar, ut ne impune in nos illuseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum dixisset in Albucium illudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeon' videmur vobis esse idonei, In quibus sic illudatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21568.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuseras heri inter scyphos, quod dixeram controversiam esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21568.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sport</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fool away</hi> a thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">waste in sport;</hi> in mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n21568.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (frondi) Silvestres uri assidue capraeque sequaces Illudunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae illudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar etiam matri ejus illusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueritiae Britannici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum illustrium capitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21568.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum variae illudant pestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 181</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21568.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (in all the meanings of I.). </sense><sense id="n21568.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to play at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illusas auro vestes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lightly interwoven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 464</bibl></cit> (dub. al. inclusas); imitated by <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 1258</bibl>; cf. the periphrase: illusa pictae vestis inania, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 104.—</sense><sense id="n21568.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn. </sense><sense id="n21568.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To scoff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mock at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a laughing-stock of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ridicule</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">satis superbe illuditis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is, qui illusus sit plus vidisse videatur. Quid autem turpius quam illudi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illusi ac destituti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetiis illusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergisne eam, Laeli, artem illudere, in qua primum excello ipse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa praecepta (rhetorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud nimium acumen (opp. admirari ingenium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces Neronis, quoties caneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 52</bibl></cit>: verbis virtutem superbis,<pb n="887" /> <cb n="ILLU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 634</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21568.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: illusique pedes (i. e. crapulā) vitiosum ferre recusant Corpus, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">staggering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuminabilis: <entryFree id="n21569" type="main" key="illu_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>illumino</etym>, <sense id="n21569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be illuminated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> de Stat. An. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuminate: <entryFree id="n21570" type="main" key="illu_mi^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illumino <sense id="n21570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illuminatio: <entryFree id="n21571" type="main" key="illu_mi^na_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnātio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illumino</etym>, <sense id="n21571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lighting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlightening</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n21571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus tui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 43, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21571.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Adv. Herm. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuminator: <entryFree id="n21572" type="main" key="illu_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enlightener</hi> (eccl. Lat.), trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">religionis Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Adv. Marc. 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuminatrix: <entryFree id="n21573" type="main" key="illu_mi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illuminator</etym>, <sense id="n21573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who enlightens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illumino: <entryFree id="n21574" type="main" key="illu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-lumino</etym>, <sense id="n21574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illuminate</hi> (class.; cf. illustro). </sense><sense id="n21574.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna illuminata a sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteum (sole),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulata gallinarum parvis fenestellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:575" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21574.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to embellish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> with any thing bright: <cit><quote lang="la">corona aurea fulgentibus gemmis illuminata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura omnem vestem illuminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21574.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set in a clear light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make conspicuous</hi> (esp. freq. in rhetor. lang. of brilliant oratory): <cit><quote lang="la">translatum, quod maxime tamquam stellis quibusdam notat et illuminat orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 170</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem translatorum nitore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudinem rerum (claritas orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:73" default="NO">8, 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum fidem Mitylenaeorum perfidia illuminavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi Thebas unum os Pindari illuminaret,</quote> <trans><tr>made illustrious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuminata sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 213</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luminously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuminus: <entryFree id="n21575" type="main" key="illu_mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūmĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-lumen</etym>, <sense id="n21575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae Proserpinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illunis: <entryFree id="n21576" type="main" key="illu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-luna</etym>, <sense id="n21576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moonless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without moonlight</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:619" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 619</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 2, 3</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">illūnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis illunio tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tenebris illuniae caliginis impeditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 232, 18.</sense></entryFree>
illuo: <entryFree id="n21577" type="spur" key="illuo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illuo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, false reading instead of alluo</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 74</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:16:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 16, § 3</bibl>.</entryFree>
illurgavonenses: <entryFree id="n21578" type="main" key="Illurgavonenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Illurgavonenses</orth>, v. Ilergavonenses.</entryFree>
illuricus: <entryFree id="n21579" type="main" key="Illu^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Illŭrĭcus</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illŭrĭi</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, v. Illyr.</entryFree>
illusio: <entryFree id="n21580" type="main" key="illu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>illudo</etym>, <sense id="n21580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeering; irony</hi>, a figure of speech, = derisio, insultatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 202</bibl>; also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 54</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21580.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An illusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 37, 7</bibl>; Isa. 66, 4.</sense></entryFree>
illusor: <entryFree id="n21581" type="main" key="illu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūsor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mocker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoffer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 253" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 253 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illusorius: <entryFree id="n21582" type="main" key="illu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ironical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a mocking character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cons. Evang. 3:13:46" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cons. Evang. 3, 13, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illustramentum: <entryFree id="n21583" type="hapax" key="illustra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustrāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>illustro</etym>, <sense id="n21583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an embellishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi> of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:149" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illustratio: <entryFree id="n21584" type="hapax" key="illustra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in rhetoric, <sense id="n21584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vivid representation</hi>: insequetur <foreign lang="greek">e)na/rgeia</foreign>, quae a Cicerone illustratio et evidentia nominatur, quae non tam dicere videtur quam ostendere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illustrator: <entryFree id="n21585" type="main" key="illustra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enlightener</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus illustrator rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 6, 129.</sense></entryFree>
illustratus: <entryFree id="n21586" type="main" key="illustra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity of an eminent man; respectability</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 1, 13, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illustre: <entryFree id="n21587" type="main" key="illustre"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustre</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. illustris <sense id="n21587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illustris: <entryFree id="n21588" type="main" key="illustris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n21588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing. masc.</hi> illuster. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:11" default="NO">4, 3, 11</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inlustro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">lighted up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lustrous</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n21588.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ostendebat Carthaginem de excelso et pleno stellarum, illustri et claro quodam <cb n="ILLU" /> loco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum nec nimis illustres nec vehementer obscuros locos haberi oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare bonis et illustribus domiciliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balnearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustris et pellucida stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 16, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:528" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 528</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostio et lumine illustriore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solis candor illustrior est quam ullius ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ventus) tegulas illustriores fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21588.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21588.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (syn. clarus): <cit><quote lang="la">praeter haec, quae testata sunt et illustria, habeo multa occultiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rationibus tam certis tamque illustribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illustribus igitur rebus insistis ... a certis et illustrioribus cohibes assensum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero ita disseram de re tam illustri tamque nota, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">factum illustre notumque omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus insignis et illustris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustris oratio est, si, etc. ... est enim haec pars orationis, quae rem constituat paene ante oculos ... est plus aliquanto illustre quam illud dilucidum: altero fit, ut intelligamus, altero vero ut videre videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si desit illustris explanatio, propositio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruenda est vita exemplis illustribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21588.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus, insignis, spectabilis, nobilissimus, celeber, inclutus): homines illustres honore ac nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 5:18" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustrium hominum aetates et tempora persequi (shortly after: de clarorum virorum laudibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustribus in personis temporibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 32, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florens et illustris adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de antiquis illustrissimus quisque pastor erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum illustrissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <trans><tr>noble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illustribus provinciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorundam illustrium exsequiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterfamiliae illustriore loco natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistoclis nomen est quam Solonis illustrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae ratio illustrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt illustriora quae publice fiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vides quanto expressiora quantoque illustriora futura sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major atque illustrior res,</quote> <trans><tr>more important</tr>, <tr>more remarkable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum illustrium quascumque defendi nunc conficio orationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to II. A.), <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuously</hi> (very rare; only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">illustrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustrissime descripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illustro: <entryFree id="n21589" type="main" key="illustro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illustro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>illustris</etym>, <sense id="n21589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illuminate</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n21589.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">o, qua sol habitabiles Illustrat oras, maxime principum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida nocte leniter illustrante stellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergastulum angustis illustratum fenestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl>, read lustret).—</sense><sense id="n21589.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to illustris, II. A. and B.). </sense><sense id="n21589.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make clear</hi> to the mind, <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elucidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea consilia, quae clam essent inita contra salutem urbis, illustrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illustrantur, erumpunt omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia illustrata, patefacta, comperta sunt per me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo id patefactum et illustratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">jus obscurum et ignotum patefacere et illustrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam veterem Latinis litteris illustrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustrant eam (orationem) quasi stellae quaedam translata verba atque immutata,</quote> <trans><tr>place in the right light</tr>, <tr>embellish</tr>, <tr>set off</tr>, <tr>adorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de illustranda oratione ut diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:14" default="NO">8, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:2" default="NO">11, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21589.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To render famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>: aliquem laudibus, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Brutus cognomine suo illustravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustrabit, mihi crede, tuam amplitudinem hominum injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: humilius genus <cb n="IMAC" /> illustrasse factis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa quibus illustratur forum ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Padus poenā Phaëthontis illustratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina maxime illustrata Messalae potu et salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 67</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid prius illustrem satiris Musaque pedestri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
illusus: <entryFree id="n21590" type="main" key="illu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from illudo.</entryFree>
illutibarbus: <entryFree id="n21591" type="hapax" key="illu_ti^barbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūtĭbarbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>illutus-barba</etym>, <sense id="n21591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a filthy beard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsyas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 341, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illutilis: <entryFree id="n21592" type="main" key="illu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūtĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-luo</etym>, <sense id="n21592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be washed out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit> (cf. inlutibilis, Non. s. v. spurcum, p. 394, 18), Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
illutus: <entryFree id="n21593" type="main" key="illu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. illotus.</entryFree>
illuvies: <entryFree id="n21594" type="main" key="illu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illŭvĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inl-</orth>), <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-luo</etym>. <sense id="n21594.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncleanness</hi> of the body (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: alluvies, diluvies, colluvies, proluvies; squalor, sordes, paedor): hic cruciatur fame, frigore, illuvie, imbalnitie, imperfundie, incuria, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">125, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus illuvie scabrum, Cic. poët. Tusc. 3, 12, 26: illuvie ac squalore obsitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuvie deformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo illuvieque peresa vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">di te perdant ... oboluisti allium, Germana illuvies, hircus, hara suis,</quote> <trans><tr>you perfect beast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21594.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:10" default="NO">2, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the water that has overflowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber campos lubricos fecerat, gravesque currus illuvie haerebant,</quote> <trans><tr>in the mud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illuviosus: <entryFree id="n21595" type="main" key="illu^vi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">illŭvĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>illuvies</etym>, <sense id="n21595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetrum dicitur illuviosum, fetidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 413, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
illyrii: <entryFree id="n21596" type="main" key="Illy^ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭi</orth> (archaic orthog. Ilurii, Plaut, Men. 2, 1, 10), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)illu/pioi</foreign>, <sense id="n21596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Dalmatia and Albania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 9</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n21596.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21596.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Illyrians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Illyrian</hi>: ager, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21596.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; as consisting of two parts, Roman and Grecian Illyria, also in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl> (3, 8), 10.—</sense><sense id="n21596.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭcus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Illuricus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 10</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Illyrians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Illyrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Illyricis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in Illyria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21596.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illyrĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: gens, Val. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>: omnes, Cod. Th. 10, 10, 26.—</sense><sense id="n21596.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Illy-ris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Illyrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:225" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:292" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epidamnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 624</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilotae: <entryFree id="n21597" type="main" key="Ilo_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Hilotae.</entryFree>
iluro: <entryFree id="n21598" type="main" key="Iluro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iluro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">the modern Maltaeo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilurensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Iluro</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 406, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilus: <entryFree id="n21599" type="main" key="I_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=ilos</foreign>. <sense id="n21599.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Tros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Assaracus and Ganymede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Laomedon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Trojans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of Ilium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 756</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21599.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Surname of</hi> Ascanius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1</bibl>. 268.—</sense><sense id="n21599.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 400</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilva: <entryFree id="n21600" type="main" key="Ilva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the modern Island of Elba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Mediterranean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>; Plin 3, 6, 12, § 81; 34, 14, 41, § 142; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 39, 2</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:617" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 617</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ilvates: <entryFree id="n21601" type="main" key="Ilva_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilvātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Ligurian tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
im: <entryFree id="n21602" type="main" key="im"><orth extent="full" lang="la">im</orth>, i. q. eum, v. is <sense id="n21602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imacharensis: <entryFree id="n21603" type="main" key="Ima^cha^rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imăchărensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Imăcărensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n21603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Imachăra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city in the northeastern part of Sicily</hi>, now perh. <hi rend="ital">Traina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 47</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Imăchărenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <pb n="888" /> <cb n="IMAG" /> <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Imachara</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 42, 100</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Imăcărenses</orth>, <itype>the same</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imaginabilis: <entryFree id="n21604" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imago</etym>, <sense id="n21604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conceivable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginable</hi>: res, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 5, pros. 4 and 5.</sense></entryFree>
imaginabundus: <entryFree id="n21605" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imaginor</etym>, <sense id="n21605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that represents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pictures to himself</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">carnificem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imaginalis: <entryFree id="n21606" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imago</etym>, <sense id="n21606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figurative</hi> (late Lat.): descriptio Judaeorum, Vet. interpr. Iren. 5, 11.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnālĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi>, Aug. de Gen. ad lit. 12, 5; 6.</sense></entryFree>
imaginarie: <entryFree id="n21607" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^na_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imaginarius <sense id="n21607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imaginarius: <entryFree id="n21608" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imago</etym>. <sense id="n21608.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to images</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>- (late Lat.): pictor, plastes, Edict. Diocl. p. 22.—</sense><sense id="n21608.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imaginarius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. imaginifer, <hi rend="ital">the bearer of the emperor's image</hi> (as a standard), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21608.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That exists only in imagination</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nominal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi> (syn.: falsus, simulatus; opp. verus; <cit><quote lang="la">not anteAug.): fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titulus nuptiarum (with falsus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:113" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:169" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:173" default="NO">173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginariae militiae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus, Capit. Pertin. 15: et scaenicus rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indictio belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:58:27" default="NO">58, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. Sap. 3, 3</bibl></cit>. —* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to imagination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effingere epigrammata,</quote> <trans><tr>as fancy prompts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imaginatio: <entryFree id="n21609" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imaginor</etym>, <sense id="n21609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mental image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagination</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum imaginationes in somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias secretis imaginationibus agitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imagineus: <entryFree id="n21610" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imago</etym>, <sense id="n21610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>- (late Lat.): figurae, <hi rend="ital">image-figures</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that serve as likenesses</hi>, Ven. Fort. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:276" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 276</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for refusing to worship an image</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 187</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imaginifer: <entryFree id="n21611" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>imago-fero</etym>, <sense id="n21611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an image-bearer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who bears the emperor's image</hi> (as a standard), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3478 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
imagino: <entryFree id="n21612" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n21612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>imago</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give an image of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut speculum in loco certo positum nihil imaginat, aliorsum translatum facit imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram digitis suis imaginatam metuere et adorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
imaginor: <entryFree id="n21613" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n21613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to picture to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse etiam M. Tullius quaerit adhuc eum (eloquentem), et tantum imaginatur ac fingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:41" default="NO">9, 2, 41</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fercula triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solum quae facta sint aut fiant, sed etiam quae futura sint aut futura fuerint, imaginamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem per somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 143</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of dreams: Calpurnia uxor imaginata est, collabi fastigium domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imaginosus: <entryFree id="n21614" type="main" key="i^ma_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of fancies</hi>: non est sana puella; <cit><quote lang="la">solet esse imaginosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 41, 8</bibl></cit> Müll. dub.</sense></entryFree>
imago: <entryFree id="n21615" type="main" key="i^ma_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. imitor</etym>, <sense id="n21615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi> (i. e. a picture, statue, mask, an apparition, ghost, phantom; the latter only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: simulacrum, effigies, statua, sigillum): imago ab imitatione dicta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=112" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 112</bibl> Müll.; cf.: imago dicitur quasi imitago, Porphyr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 4</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n21615.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21615.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi> (usu. of a person), <hi rend="ital">statue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spartiates Agesilaus neque pictam neque fictam imaginem suam passus est esse ... unus Xenophontis libellus in eo rege laudando facile omnes imagines omnium statuasque superavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes, cujus nuper inter imagines tuas ac tuorum imaginem ex aere vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri in poculis et in anulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: hominis imaginem gypso e facie ipsa primus omnium expressit ceraque in eam formam gypsi infusa emendare instituit Lysistratus Sicyonius, <cb n="IMAG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 44, § 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antigoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depictam in tabula sipariove imaginem rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in tabula mea aliquis pinxerit velut imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:78" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cereae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:76" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dignus venias hederis et imagine macra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi sub nostra breve carmen imagine vivat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula atque imago me certum fecit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the image on the seal</tr>, <tr>the signet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc amici anne inimici sis imago, Alcesime, mihi, sciam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will act like a friend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21615.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A phantom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ghost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix simulacrum atque ipsius umbra Creusae Visa mihi ante oculos et nota major imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 773</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc magna mei sub terras ibit imago,</quote> <trans><tr>shade</tr>, <tr>spirit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 654</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vanae redeat sanguis imagini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(somnus) Vanum nocturnis fallit imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te videt in somnis, tua sacra et major imago humana turbat pavidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid natum totiens falsis Ludis imaginibus?</quote> <trans><tr>phantoms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubique pavor et plurima mortis imago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 369</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitaque mortis imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurida mortis imago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123, v. 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varia pereuntium forma et omni imagine mortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesorum insepultorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremorum (i. e. funeris) imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitiva (with forma),</quote> <trans><tr>natural shape</tr>, <tr>figure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 331</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rudis et sine imagine tellus (= informis),</quote> <trans><tr>shapeless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21615.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an ancestral image</hi> of a distinguished Roman (of one who had been aedile, praetor, or consul; usually made of wax, and placed in the atrium of a Roman house, and carried in funeral processions.—</sense><sense id="n21615.5" n="(a)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>: obrepsisti ad honores errore hominum, commendatione fumosarum imaginum, quarum simile habes nihil praeter colorem, <hi rend="ital">of smoky</hi> (i. e. old) <hi rend="ital">ancestral images</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:28:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid deliquero, nullae sunt imagines, quae me a vobis
