deprecentur,</quote> <trans><tr>no ancestors of distinction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia imagines non habeo et quia mihi nova nobilitas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui imagines familiae suae consecuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo veteris prosapiae ac multarum imaginum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in familia senatoriis imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esto beata, funus atque imagines Ducant triumphales tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stupet in titulis et imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 6</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21615.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jus imaginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginis ornandae causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir honoratissimae imaginis futurus ad posteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarum hac fore imagine Scaptium,</quote> <trans><tr>would become an aristocrat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 72, 4</bibl></cit>, v. Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tunc Cotta ne imago Libonis exsequias posterorum comitaretur censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21615.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a reverberation of sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an echo</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(mellaria facere oportet) potissimum ubi non resonent imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concava pulsu Saxa sonant, vocisque offensa resultat imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:365" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 365</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternae deceptus imagine vocis: Huc coëamus ait ... Coëamus retulit Echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus recinit jocosa Nomen imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jocosa Vaticani montis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:596" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 596</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21615.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21615.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an image</hi> or <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi> of a thing formed in the mind, <hi rend="ital">a conception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionis memoriam atque imaginem sibi proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem noctium in imagine tua vigil exigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verginium cogito, Verginium video, Verginium jam vanis imaginibus audio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: imagines, quae <foreign lang="greek">ei)/dwla</foreign> nominant, quorum incursione non solum videmus, sed etiam cogitamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines extrinsecus in animos nostros per corpus irrumpere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: plena sunt imaginum omnia, nulla species cogitari potest nisi pulsu imaginum, etc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:137 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 67, 137 sq.</bibl>: unum aliquem te ex barbatis illis, exemplum imperii veteris, imaginem antiquitatis, columen<cb n="IMBE" />  rei publicae diceres intueri, <hi rend="ital">an image of the olden time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expressam imaginem vitae quotidianae videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidnam illi consules dictatoresve facturi essent, qui proconsularem imaginem tam saevam ac trucem fecerint, i. e. by cruelty in office,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae ... urbis et populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudines ad exprimendas rerum imagines compositae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: illae rerum imagines, quas vocari <foreign lang="greek">fantasi/as</foreign> indicavimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscripta formantur imagine templa,</quote> <trans><tr>plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:117" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scipione determinata prius templi imagine in solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua, pater Druse, imago,</quote> <trans><tr>memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna illic imago tristium laetorumque,</quote> <trans><tr>recollection</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te nulla movet tantae pietatis imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 405</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21615.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21615.11" n="1" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figurative representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparabile est, quod in rebus diversis similem aliquam rationem continet. Ejus partes sunt tres: imago, collatio, exemplum. Imago est oratio demonstrans corporum aut naturarum similitudinem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imago est formae cum forma cum quadam similitudine collatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 320</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 34</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21615.12" n="2" level="3"> With the idea predominating of mere imitation, in opp. to what is original or real, <hi rend="ital">a mere form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shadow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consectatur nullam eminentem effigiem virtutis, sed adumbratam imaginem gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos veri juris germanaeque justitiae solidam et expressam effigiem nullam tenemus: umbra et imaginibus utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non in umbra et imagine civitatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram equitis Romani et imaginem videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ars tota dicendi, sive artis imago quaedam est et similitudo, habet hanc vim, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciorum,</quote> <trans><tr>only the appearance of courts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem rei publicae nullam reliquissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his quoque imaginibus juris spretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem retinendi largiendive penes nos, vim penes Parthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitu et ore ad exprimendam imaginem honesti exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>the pretence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 32</bibl></cit>; 6, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui faciem eloquentiae, non imaginem praestaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec imagine rerum, sed rebus incendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in falsa rerum imagine detineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo quippe alio vincis discrimine, quam quod illi (hermae) marmoreum caput est, tua vivit imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21615.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A representative</hi>: non in effigies mutas divinum (Augusti) spiritum transfusum; <cit><quote lang="la">sed imaginem veram, caelesti sanguine ortam, intellegere discrimen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21615.14" n="4" level="3"> That which suggests or recalls something by resemblance, <hi rend="ital">a reminder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me consolatur recordatio meorum temporum, quorum imaginem video in rebus tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Corbulone petierat, ne quam imaginem servitii Tiridates perferret,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing to suggest slavery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moriar, si praeter te quemquam reliquum habeo, in quo possim imaginem antiquae et vernaculae festivitatis adgnoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imaguncula: <entryFree id="n21616" type="hapax" key="i^ma_guncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmāguncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imago</etym>, <sense id="n21616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little image</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerea puerilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imaus: <entryFree id="n21617" type="main" key="Ima^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imăus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*)/imaos</foreign>, <sense id="n21617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great chain of mountains in Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Caspian Sea and the Ganges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 21</bibl>, §§ 60 and 64.</sense></entryFree>
imbalnities: <entryFree id="n21618" type="hapax" key="imbalni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbalnĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-balneum</etym>, <sense id="n21618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unbathed condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthiness</hi>: hic cruciatur fame, illuvie, imbalnitie, etc., Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imbarbescere: <entryFree id="n21619" type="gloss" key="imbarbesce^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbarbescĕre</orth>, <itype>barbatum fieri</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
imbecille: <entryFree id="n21620" type="main" key="imbe_cille_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbēcillē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imbecillus <sense id="n21620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imbecillis: <entryFree id="n21621" type="main" key="imbe_cillis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbēcillis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, v. imbecillus <sense id="n21621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imbecillitas: <entryFree id="n21622" type="main" key="imbe_cilli^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbēcillĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imbecillus</etym>, <sense id="n21622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebleness</hi> (class.; cf. infirmitas). </sense><sense id="n21622.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the body: Tulliae meae morbus et imbecillitas corporis me exanimat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium (with infirmitas laterum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Niciae nostri (with mollitia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with senium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 44</bibl></cit>: imbecillitate Augusti <pb n="889" /> <cb n="IMBE" /> nuntiata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suae imbecillitati sanitatis appellationem, quae est maxime contraria, optendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21622.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of condition as regards ability, <hi rend="ital">powerlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impotency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helplessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbecility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum propter imbecillitatem atque inopiam desiderata sit amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 25, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis imbecillitatem fragilitatemque extimescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21622.3" n="II" level="1"> Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallit plerumque, quod probitas vocatur, quae est imbecillitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illos imbecillitatis damnandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbecillosus: <entryFree id="n21623" type="main" key="imbe_cillo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbēcillōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imbecillus</etym>, <sense id="n21623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feeble</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus hominis post peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ver. Rel. 15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ver. Rel. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbecillus: <entryFree id="n21624" type="main" key="imbe_cillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbēcillus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-bēcillis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, Sen. de Ira, 3, 28, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Clem. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Clem. 2, 6, 3</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 93 sq.), <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n21624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi> (class.; cf.: debilis, imbellis). </sense><sense id="n21624.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the body. </sense><sense id="n21624.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homo imbecillus a valentissima bestia laniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi sunt imbecilli senes ... quam fuit imbecillus P. Africani filius! quam tenui aut nulla potius valetudine!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et absentes (amici) assunt et egentes abundant et imbecilli valent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecilliores (opp. firmiores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius et valetudine et natura imbecillior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo e nobis imbecillus fuit, cujus salus ac valetudo non sustentaretur Caesaris cura,</quote> <trans><tr>indisposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillorum esse aecum misererier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1023" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1023</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21624.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus venarum (with exigui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillissimus ac facillimus sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedent anni et tractari mollius aetas Imbecilla volet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quomodo imbecillior est medicina quam morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14</bibl></cit>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">terra infecunda ad omnia atque imbecilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina (opp. valida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillissimam materiam esse omne olus,</quote> <trans><tr>the least nourishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—In a different sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum durum valentissimae materiae est, molle vel sorbile imbecillissimae,</quote> <trans><tr>very easy of digestion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra vultus imbecilla ac mortalia sunt: forma mentis aeterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum vobis trado firmum, si boni eritis: si mali, imbecillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21624.4" n="II" level="1"> Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eam superstitionem imbecilli animi atque anilis putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:60:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 60, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecilliores vel animo vel fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imbecillis accusatoribus accusari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 76</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavi et imbecilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imbēcillē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faintly</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">iis, quae videntur, imbecillius assentiuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillius horrent dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbellia: <entryFree id="n21625" type="main" key="imbelli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbellĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-bellum</etym>, <sense id="n21625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfitness for war</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignavia imbelliaque militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: imbelliam belli inscientiam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
imbellis: <entryFree id="n21626" type="main" key="imbellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbellis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwarlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfit for war; peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fond of peace</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: imbecillis, debilis). </sense><sense id="n21626.1" n="I" level="1"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">ut imbelles timidique videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavi et imbelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidi et imbelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: ipse acer, bellicosus; <cit><quote lang="la">at is, quem petebat, quietus, imbellis, placido ingenio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenui et imbelles inulti obtruncari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 67, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro viro forti contra imbellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: turba (i. e. <hi rend="ital">non-combatants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">women and children</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae puerique et alia imbellis turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbellis et pastoralis manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesorum major numerus et imbellior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 265</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus and Amor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime Caesar, qui nunc victor ... Inbellem avertis Romanis arcibus Indum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deprived of warlike spirit by defeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21626.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cb n="IMBI" /> itaque videas rebus injustis justos maxime dolere, imbellibus fortes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fatus senior, telumque imbelle sine ictu Conjecit,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>, <tr>powerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 544</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentum,</quote> <trans><tr>peaceful</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rem Romanam tam desidem umquam fuisse atque imbellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:874" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 874</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:362" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <trans><tr>calm</tr>, <tr>tranquil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 255</bibl>. —Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen ne prorsus inbellem agerent annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1, 4</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferme bellis otium fuit, § 1): triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultos annos imbelles agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 45, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imber: <entryFree id="n21627" type="main" key="imber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imber</orth>, <itype>bris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> imbri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 715</bibl> et saep.; <sense id="n21627.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">more freq. imbre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6</bibl>. 68; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 889</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 239 sq.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. to Sanscr. abhra, a cloud; cf. Lat. umbra; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/mbros</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violent rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rain-storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shower of rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pelting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pouring rain</hi> (cf.: pluvia, nimbus). </sense><sense id="n21627.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imbres fluctusque atque procellae infensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit imber, lavit parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat hiems summa, tempestas perfrigida, imber maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita magnos et assiduos imbres habebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximo imbri Capuam veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in imbri, in frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter factum corruptius imbri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 95</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imbre lutoque Aspersus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae opera per imbrem fieri potuerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: lapideus aut sanguineus imber, Civ. Div. 2, 28, 60; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cum saepe lapidum, sanguinis nonnumquam, terrae interdum, quondam etiam lactis imber defluxit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbri lapidavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam lapides effuderit imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21627.2" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n21627.3" n="a" level="4"> Imbrem in cribrum gerere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to attempt an impossibility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21627.4" n="b" level="4"> Tam hoc tibi in proclivi est quam imber est quando pluit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exceedingly easy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21627.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n21627.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rain-cloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stormcloud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleus supra caput astitit imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandinis imbres,</quote> <trans><tr>hail-storms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21627.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rain-water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinae cisternaeque servandis imbribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21627.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Water</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi> in gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): cui par imber et ignis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 511 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">so of water as an element: ex igni, terra atque anima procrescere et imbri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferrum Stridit, ubi in gelidum propere demersimus imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: ratibusque fremebat Imber Neptuni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 299</bibl> (Ann. v. 490 Vahl.); so of <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:665" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 665</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos irriget imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbre per indignas usque cadente genas,</quote> <trans><tr>a shower of tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineus,</quote> <trans><tr>stream of blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:437" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 437</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21627.9" n="D" level="2"> Like the Engl. word <hi rend="ital">shower</hi>, of things that fall like rain: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreus ingruit imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 284</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto Danaae misisse aiunt quondam in gremium imbrem aureum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imberbis: <entryFree id="n21628" type="main" key="imberbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imberbis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in - barba; cf.: infamis, informis</etym>, <sense id="n21628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a beard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beardless</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non convenire barbatum esse filium (Aesculapium), cum pater (Apollo) imberbis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Imberbes didicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">imberbus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: androgyni, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 27</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1</bibl>, Fragm. 3 (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 74</bibl>): quod maximi sunt iidemque imberbi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imberbus juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 161</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imbibo: <entryFree id="n21629" type="main" key="imbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbĭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>bi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-bibo</etym>, <sense id="n21629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbibe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">is nidor per infurnibulum imbibitur in vetere tussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 85, § 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21629.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi imbibunt tenebras,</quote> <trans><tr>become darkened</tr>, <tr>blind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21629.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to imbibe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi> (class.): de aliquo malam opinionem<cb n="IMBR" />  animo imbibere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternas artes ingenio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21629.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolve</hi> to do a thing (usually with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod si facere nolit atque imbiberit ejusmodi rationibus illum ad suas condiciones perducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex ira poenas petere imbibat acres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:997" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 997</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque immemor ejus, quod initio consulatus im biberat, reconciliandi animos plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbito: <entryFree id="n21630" type="hapax" key="imbi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbīto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-bito</etym>, <sense id="n21630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meam domum ne imbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbonitas: <entryFree id="n21631" type="hapax" key="imbo^ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbŏnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-bonitas</etym>, <sense id="n21631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconvenience</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis duritia et imbonitas et insuavitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Martyr. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbracteo: <entryFree id="n21632" type="main" key="imbracte^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbractĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inbr-</orth>), no <sense id="n21632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-bracteo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to overlay with leafmetal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">statuas auro imbracteari,</quote> <trans><tr>be gilded over</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aereum opus auro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora solida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrasides: <entryFree id="n21633" type="main" key="Imbra^si^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbrăsĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n21633.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
imbrasus: <entryFree id="n21634" type="main" key="Imbra^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbrăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Æneas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Glaucus and Lades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 343</bibl>.—The latter called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbrăsĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> Imbrasidas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 343</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Asius Imbrasides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrex: <entryFree id="n21635" type="main" key="imbrex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (less freq. <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl>) [imber], <sense id="n21635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow tile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gutter-tile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantile</hi> (used in roofs for the purpose of leading off the rain; cf.: tegula, operculum, tectorium). </sense><sense id="n21635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tegulae vocatae, quod tegant aedes; <cit><quote lang="la">et imbrices quod accipiant imbres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meas confregisti imbrices et tegulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 28</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 296</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21635.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things shaped like a pantile. </sense><sense id="n21635.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trough</hi> for watering beasts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:9" default="NO">2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21635.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A certain part of a hog</hi> (either the ear, sparerib, or womb), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 37, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21635.5" n="C" level="2"> Imbrex narium, <hi rend="ital">the partition</hi> (saeptum) <hi rend="ital">in the nose</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21635.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mode of applauding with the hands formed into hollows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invented by Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrialis: <entryFree id="n21636" type="main" key="imbri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rain</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>rain - water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:122" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:13:167" default="NO">2, 13, 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imbricatim: <entryFree id="n21637" type="main" key="imbri^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>imbrex</etym>, <sense id="n21637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a gutter-tile</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">undata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbricitor: <entryFree id="n21638" type="main" key="Imbri^ci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbrĭcĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>imber-cieo</etym>, <sense id="n21638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who causes showers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the shower - sender</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): spiritus Austri Imbricitor, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 424 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo deus Imbricitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 49</bibl></cit>: Juppiter dicitur etiam Imbricitor et item Serenator, App. de Mundo, p. 75.</sense></entryFree>
imbricitur: <entryFree id="n21639" type="gloss" key="imbri^ci^tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭcĭtur</orth> <foreign lang="greek">o)mbrou=tai, bre/xetai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
imbrico: <entryFree id="n21640" type="main" key="imbri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n21640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>imbrex</etym>. </sense><sense id="n21640.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cover with gutter-tiles</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">tegulis interjacentibus imbricarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21640.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To form like a gutter-tile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementa inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus folio per margines imbricato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues simiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbricus: <entryFree id="n21641" type="main" key="imbri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imber</etym>, <sense id="n21641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rainy</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Auster,</quote> <trans><tr>rain-bringing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitium (opp. hiems serena),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: imbrica tempestate pluviam videtur significare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
imbridus: <entryFree id="n21642" type="main" key="imbri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rainy</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum (opp. siccum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrifer: <entryFree id="n21643" type="main" key="imbri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imber-fero</etym>, <sense id="n21643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rain - bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rainy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>overflowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:62:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 62, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrifico: <entryFree id="n21644" type="main" key="imbri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>imber-facio</etym>, <sense id="n21644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rain upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terram aquis (aër),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrilis: <entryFree id="n21645" type="main" key="imbri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imber</etym>, <sense id="n21645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of rain</hi> (= imbrialis): <cit><quote lang="la">fontana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:de Sal. Praec. 39" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> de Sal. Praec. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrius: <entryFree id="n21646" type="main" key="Imbri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n21646.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
imbros: <entryFree id="n21647" type="main" key="Imbros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbros</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Imbrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*)/imbros</foreign>, <sense id="n21647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over against</hi> <pb n="890" /> <cb n="IMBU" /> <hi rend="ital">the</hi> Chersonesus Thracica, <hi rend="ital">near Lemnos and Samothrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Imbro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—Called Imbria terra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imbrumari: <entryFree id="n21648" type="gloss" key="imbru_ma_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbrūmāri</orth> <itype>dicuntur</itype>, quibus fastidium est ciborum. Edacitas enim Graece <foreign lang="greek">brw=ma</foreign> appellatur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 35, 6</bibl> (a corrupted word).</entryFree>
imbubino: <entryFree id="n21649" type="hapax" key="imbubi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbubĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>‡ bubino</etym>, <sense id="n21649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to befoul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>: ‡ bubinare est menstruo mulierum sanguine inquinare. Lucilius: Haec, inquit, te imbubinat, at contra te imbulbitat. Imbulbitare est puerili stercore inquinare, dictum ex fimo, quod Graeci appellant <foreign lang="greek">bo/lbiton</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
imbulbito: <entryFree id="n21650" type="main" key="imbulbi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbulbĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n21650.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
imbuo: <entryFree id="n21651" type="main" key="imbu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in- and root biv-; cf. bibo, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n21651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, etc. (class.; cf.: inficio, infusco). </sense><sense id="n21651.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquoribus lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: tapetes, quos concha purpura imbuens venenavit, Cn. Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cados amurca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 8, 8, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttura lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:131" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbuti sanguine gladii legionum vel madefacti potius,</quote> <trans><tr>wet</tr>, <tr>or rather dripping with blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis novus imbuit arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis imbuta sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus tabo imbutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela imbuta veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula, quae Venus Quinta parte sui nectaris imbuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odore imbuta Testa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium quae sunt inbuta colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 734</bibl></cit> Munro.—</sense><sense id="n21651.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21651.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbrue</hi> with any thing (esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): morte manus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 521, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus promissis aures militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum sanguine manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21651.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua humanitate imbuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">religione imbuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbutus admiratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones favore Othonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles longo Caesarum sacramento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbuti et infecti Romanis delenimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbutus alicujus consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac ille crudelitate imbutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociale bellum macula sceleris imbutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonorum caede imbutis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbutae caede manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbutae praeda manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21651.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21651.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To inspire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impress early</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accustom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">initiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ego de artibus gratiam facio, ne colas, ne inbuas eis tuom ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ille studiis ab ineunte aetate se imbuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum tenerum opinionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">variis erroribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentuli castrensibus stipendiis imbuebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberaliter educatos servilibus vitiis imbuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est tam immanis, cujus mentem non imbuerit deorum opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pietate omnium pectora imbuerat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter novitatem successoris, quae noscendis prius quam agendis rebus inbuenda sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbuendis sociis ad officia legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam prius imbuuntur quam contemnere deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui honestis sermonibus aures imperatoris imbuant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optume cum domito juvencus imbuitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is trained to labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21651.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To do</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">for the first time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set the example</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">illa rudem cursu prima imbuit Amphitriten,</quote> <trans><tr>was the first to navigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras vomere,</quote> <trans><tr>to plough first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:69" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phialam nectare,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 17</bibl></cit>: bellum sanguine, <hi rend="ital">to initiate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 542</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 554</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem primo Hymenaeo (conjux),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:65" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbuis exemplum primae tu, Romule, palmae,</quote> <trans><tr>begin</tr>, <tr>set the example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 654</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21651.8" n="3" level="3"> Esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat instructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">initiated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ita a majoribus instituti atque imbuti sumus, ut. etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et doctrina liberaliter institutus et aliquo jam imbutus usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentum praeceptis imbuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: imbutus<cb n="IMIT" />  rudimentis militiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imbutum jam a juventa certaminibus plebeiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitiones verborum, quibus imbuti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticis imbutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris saltem leviter imbutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi non perfectum litteris sed imbutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(verna) Litterulis Graecis imbutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam (legem) non docti, sed facti, non instituti, sed imbuti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. instructus: elementis studiorum etsi non instructus, at certe imbutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea pavonum ridenti imbuta lepore saecla,</quote> <trans><tr>endued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 502</bibl></cit> Munro (dub.; v. Lachm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 102</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
imburvum: <entryFree id="n21652" type="gloss" key="imburvum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imburvum</orth>, <itype>fictum ab urvo, quod ita flexum ut redeat sursum vorsus, ut in aratro quod est urvum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=127" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 127</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
imbutamentum: <entryFree id="n21653" type="main" key="imbu_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbūtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>imbuo, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n21653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">instruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teaching</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">varia dogmatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl></cit> prooem.</sense></entryFree>
imbutus: <entryFree id="n21654" type="main" key="imbu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imbūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from imbuo.</entryFree>
imitabilis: <entryFree id="n21655" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imitor</etym>, <sense id="n21655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be imitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitable</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">orationis subtilitas imitabilis illa quidem videtur esse existimanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:12" default="NO">10, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:19" default="NO">19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi maxime imitabilis, maxime imitandus videbaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non imitabile fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est gemma alia imitabilior mendacio vitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21655.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Imitative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined to imitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines imitabili natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imitamen: <entryFree id="n21656" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imitation;</hi> abstr. and concr., <hi rend="ital">a resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi> (Ovidian): <cit><quote lang="la">somnia, quae veras aequent imitamine formas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 626</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes, antiquae imitamina vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis peragens imitamina nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:211" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imitamentum: <entryFree id="n21657" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imitation;</hi> abstr. and concr. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum imitamenti Olympiaci Jovis,</quote> <trans><tr>the statue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>acts in imitation of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterum Romanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opplevit omnia non simulacris neque imitamentis, sed luctu atque lamentis veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
